Quillabamba is the capital city of the province of La Convención. It is an important commercial center of the Lares and La Convención valleys. The main activities there are the production of coca, coffee, cacao and fruit.   

In the city of Quillabamba we visit the “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” [Brave Hearts of Morro San Juan] community bank and we meet a member named Margot. She tells us the following:  

 “I was born in the city of Quillabamba. I am 26 years old, I have a son and I live in the same city where I was born. My main activity is raising small animals”. 

Margot is a fighter and an enterprising woman. Despite adversity, she raises small animals such as chickens. She feed them with nutrients and supplements. After fattening them up, she sells them in the city of Quillabamba. At this time, she needs the loan to buy feed for the chickens.

loans.use: to buy feed for chickens.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El  Señor Mario  de  32 años de edad, estado civil soltero pero convive con su pareja, vive en casa de sus suegros,  trabaja con su vehículo como taxi  desde hace 4 años para mantener su familia. Su pareja la Sra. Eynny  le ayuda con los gastos vendiendo sodas en su casa. Don Mario  se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a que necesitaba comprar un motor para su vehículo. El cuenta con un buen historial de deuda, actualmente no posee otra deuda en ninguna institución, es cliente antiguo, es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario, 32, is single but lives with his partner in his in-laws’ house.  He has been using his car as a taxi for the last four years to support his family.  His partner is Eynny and she helps cover expenses selling soft-drinks at home.

Mario needed to request a loan from our institution because he needed to buy an engine for his car.  He has a good credit history and currently has no debts in any institution.  He’s a longstanding client and a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead and who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a car engine and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Nashiba

texts.en:
Nashiba works hard to support her family. Nashiba is married and has a business buying and selling ready to wear in the Philippines.

Nashiba requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional clothing stock to sell.

Nashiba has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Nashiba would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 57 year-old married woman with 7 children. She works as a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato.  Susan grows rice and corn crops to sell.  She is able to provide for her family through her income from farming.

Susan has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 46 years old. He is married with five children aged 3 months to 16 years, and lives in his own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. He has been operating a hardware business for three years, and he faces a challenge of people who take items on credit and then don't pay on time, which affects the profits of his business. His business plan is to upgrade the shop to a wholesale one and open a new outlet.

Leonard needs the loan to buy hardware items to sell.

loans.use: to buy hardware items to sell.

loans.name: Ibrohimchon

texts.ru: Иброхимчон проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 21 год. Холост. У него имеется столовая, где он работает поваром. В этой области Иброхимчон уже год. Он берет кредит для ремонта столовой.
texts.en: Ibrohimchon lives in the town of Khujand.  He is 21 years old, single.  He has a cafe, where he works as a chef.  Ibrohimchon has been in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his cafe.

loans.use: to make repairs to his cafe

loans.name: Yessenia Marisol

texts.es: Yessenia, solicita un nuevo préstamo, el cual necesita para fortalecer su negocio y comprar: leña, maíz, con los cuales tendrá producto para poder seguir aumentando en su negocio y comprara los insumos para la siembra de (abono, herbicidas para las plagas, ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, y ella lo apoyara pues la cosecha tambien servira para el negocio. Este es su segundo prestamo y hasta el momento ha estado al dia con el pago de las cuotas, actuando de manera responsable.
texts.en: Yessenia is requesting a new loan, which she needs to strengthen her business. She will purchase firewood and corn which she will use to make more tortillas so she can continue expanding her business. She will also buy supplies for planting (manure and herbicides for weeds), since her husband earns a living by farming, and she will help him because the harvest will also go for the business. This is her second loan and so far she has been acting in a responsible manner, by being on time with her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood, and supplies for planting

loans.name: Sukkar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and a father of five children.

Sukkar has been an owner of a store since 2005, selling household items and repairing satellite. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is becoming well known, and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $1500 loan in order to renovate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is a married woman with seven children six of whom are enrolled in school and the other one is too young for school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for family.

Saum has operated as a cashew nuts seller for the past one year; she sells her products from the market place and her potential clients are the people who come to the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where the cashew nuts are available only during the harvesting season. She aspires to become a cashew nuts supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase ten bags of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access fund to help her boost her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Unión Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Unión Esperanza” lo conforman 20 emprendedoras, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa y preparación de comida rápida. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de La Serena. 
Karen secretaria del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas en la primera fila de derecha a izquierda, usando una camisa a cuadros, socia sonriente. Se dedica a vender ropa nueva para niños y a preparar pan amasado. 
Los dos negocios de ropa y pan amasado los ofrece y vende en los domicilios de sus clientes. Se dedica al negocio del pan amasado desde hace 3 años y el de la ropa desde 3 meses. 
Comenta que la ropa la compra en el barrio patronato, ciudad de Santiago, dos veces al mes. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio, específicamente ropa para niños. 
Sus metas en el negocio de la ropa es tener un mayor número de clientes y con los años tener un local establecido, en cuanto al negocio del pan amasado, le gustaría tener una amasandería, para vender desde su domicilio. 
Karen vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 5 y 2 años de edad. Uno de los sueños de ella es obtener su casa propia, para esto se encuentra postulando al subsidio habitacional. 
Karen está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha brindado la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio y esto le permitirá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal es muy organizado y responsable, además las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del grupo le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio. 
La Serena es una ciudad al norte de Chile, ubicada en la  Región de Coquimbo, provincia de Elqui. 
Es un importante sitio turístico, especialmente durante el verano, donde la gente va a visitar sus playas. La ciudad se dedica principalmente al sector de los servicios, habiendo varios bancos e instituciones financieras y una variada oferta gastronómica y hotelera. En las últimas décadas, el turismo se ha convertido en unas de las actividades económicas más importantes, además la ciudad es paso obligatorio de cientos de cruceros que arriban a la ciudad de Coquimbo, en donde en La Serena encuentran el lugar de residencia provisoria para visitar la zona y el Valle de Elqui.
texts.en:
This village bank is called "Union Esperanza" and is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who are in different lines of work including clothing sales and preparing fast food. They all live in the city of La Serena. 

Karen, the secretary of the bank, is crouching in the front row of the picture in a checkered shirt, smiling. She sells new kid's clothing and makes yeast bread. She sells both the bread and the children's clothing in her customer's homes. She has been baking bread for 3 years and selling clothes for 3 months. She says she buys the clothing in the Patronato neighborhood of Santiago twice a month. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her children's clothing business. 

Her goals for her clothing business are to have more clients and after a few years to have a permanent store. For her bread business, she would like to have a bakery in her home. 

Karen lives with her husband and their children, ages 2 and 5 years old. One of her dreams is to buy their own home, so she has been applying for a housing subsidy. 

Karen is very happy and thankful for the services of Fondo Esperanza because they have given her the opportunity to invest in her business and this will allow her to give her family a better quality of life. She says that the village bank is very organized and responsible, and that the trainings at their meetings have helped her to invest better in her business. 

La Serena is a city in the north of Chile, located in the Coquimbo region in the province of Elqui. It is an important tourist site, especially during the summer when people come to the beaches. The city is primarily involved in the service sector and has various banks and financial institutions as well as many restaurants and hotels. In recent decades, tourism has become one of the most important economic activities. Hundreds of cruise ship passengers that arrive in the city of Coquimbo pass through La Serena on their way to visit the Valle de Elqui and other places in the area.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, specifically children's clothing.

loans.name: Celia Aydee

texts.es:
La señora Celia Aydee esta casada y tiene una hija de diez años de edad. 
Solicita un préstamo para la construcción del bardal alrededor de su casa ya que necesita comprar el material que es block, arena, cemento y varilla. Y así su familia se sentirá más protegida y segura  ya que la señora Celia Aydee y su esposo el señor Antonio deseen darle lo mejor, por lo cual Doña Celia Aydee trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa particular y Don Antonio empleado de una centro comercial.
texts.en:
Celia Aydee is married. She has a daughter who is ten years old.
She is requesting a loan for the construction of a wall around her house. Now she needs buy supplies like bricks, sand, cement and bars. With this, her family will feel more protected and safer. Celia Aydee and Antonio, her husband, want to give their family the best. Celia Aydee works as a domestic worker in a private home. Antonio works in shopping center.

loans.use: build a wall around her home.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 30 years old and married with three children living in Hioma, Uganda. She operates a hardware shop selling vehicle and motorcycle spare parts. She is faced with a challenge of price fluctuation and inflation. Her business goal is to expand into new markets, and her personal goal is to educate her children.

Harriet wants a loan to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy vehicle and motorcycle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a clothes selling shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Heydy Ereydy

texts.es:
Heydy Ereydy tiene 19 años es soltera, vive con la abuela, no tiene hijos. Vive en el Recinto América  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Heydy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener una casa.
Descansar.
texts.en:
Heydy Ereydy is 19 years old and single.  She lives with her grandmother and doesn't have any children.  She lives in the América district, in Ventanas canton.

The communal bank "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" ["Together We Will Overcome"] is located in the América district, which is part of Ventanas canton.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Heydy has been working in agriculture growing corn and rice for the last three years.  She purchases her supplies in Ventanas, and sells her products in the market there.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. The loan will help her to increase her income for use by her family and for investment.  Her dream is to have a home.

In her spare time, she likes to relax.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33-year-old and single. He runs a retail shop business in Mshomoroni, Mombasa for the past six years with great success. 

He is requesting for his first loan with KADET ltd of kes 20,000. He plans to purchase  stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour, and washing powders for his shop. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and gradually expand his shop. 

He hopes to expand his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour, and washing powders.

loans.name: Shwe

texts.en:
Ta Nyi Kone village is situated in Dedaye, near Myamar Delta region. There are approximately one thousand people in the village, and their main businesses are seasonal crop farming and poultry. 16 group members will use Kiva's community loan to purchase more ducks and high quality duck feed. This is critical for boosting production rates, and in turn group members’ incomes.
Picture above are five CBO committee members, Shwe, Seinn, Thein and Shane. They will oversee 30 clients. Featured borrower Shwe (standing left side in photo) is married with two children. His older son is currently attending primary school. In addition to school tuition, they have significant medical bills for their sick one year old daughter. Shwe’s family is excited to use Kiva’s loan and the resulting boosted incomes to cover these expenses and grow their business.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks and high quality duck feed

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman was born in 1953 in Baku ciy Sabunchu region. He is married, has 1 child.
Having borrowed a loan of $600 he bought materials for individual manufacture. 
He has been engaged in this business for 6 years. 
Now he needs $1200 to buy a stone cutter.

loans.use: To buy a  sone cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Loise Waithera Mwaniki intends to build five low-income rental houses

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: At age 71, Ahmad S. is the very energetic and wise owner of a small pushcart.  Every day he sells soft drinks, juices and water in the open air and moves his cart from one place to another, so he has requested $1,200 to buy a permanent place for selling his drinks.

loans.use: To upgrade his pushcart to a permanent shop

loans.name: Velushi Gillian

texts.en:
30 year-old Velushi Gillian V. is a single mother of three. She draws her motivation and determination from the difficulties she faces as a single mother in providing basic needs and education to her 3 children.

With a loan of $100, she intends to sell puff-puff and beans, a favorite dish among local inhabitants especially in the early hours of the day and towards the evening. With a regular income, she will be able to provide for her family's basic needs including education and food for her children. She plans to repay her loan in 15 months. Her first repayment will be made on the date that her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase flour, groundnut oil, firewood, beans

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sophorn started her business selling grocery items from her house in 1980. She also sells many kinds of fruit at her store. She was married in 1970 and has one daughter, who assists her in the business. Her husband is a farmer and plants vegetables in the village.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. She now requests a loan for $700. She will use this money to purchase more groceries and more fruit to sell at her store so she can expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase groceries and fruit to sell at grocery store

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es:
24274 Melquíades is a responsible father who has always watched over his family’s financial security, which allows to cover their basic needs and the education of his four beloved children. He accomplishes this by means of his agricultural activities. Melquíades cultivates his lands and cares for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small stretch of land. When he got married, he only owned a few plots of land. Nowadays, thanks to his efforts and dedication, he owns 20 hectares and two cows to fatten and sell at the local market. He makes his income at the time of harvest. He holds high hopes for the present season and wishes to continue making an effort to secure wellbeing and save the money needed to afford the treatment which will alleviate his wife's eye health issues. Melquíades is requesting a loan towards these ends and thank you for your disposition to collaborate with him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Melquíades es un padre responsable que siempre ha velado por mantener a su familia con una seguridad económica que les permita cubrir sus necesidades básicas y la educación de sus cuatro queridos hijos; esto lo hace intensamente a través de su labor agrícola. Diariamente Melquíades se dedica al cultivo de sus tierras y al cuidado de sus animales. Recuerda claramente cuando decidió independizarse con un pequeño número de animales de ganado y sus pequeñas tierras; cuando contrajo matrimonio, tenía en su poder pocos terrenos de cultivo y ahora, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, cuenta con 20 hectáreas y con 2 vacas, para engordarlas y luego comercializarlas en el mercado local. Las ganancias son obtenidas en tiempo de cosecha y para esta temporada él tiene grandes anhelos y deseos de seguir esforzándose por lograr bienestar y acumular el dinero suficiente que le permita realizar el tratamiento médico para aliviar la salud visual de su esposa. Melquíades solicita un préstamo para estos fines y agradece tu disposición de colaborar con él y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to increase production and afford the medical treatment of his beloved wife.

loans.name: Doris Azucena

texts.es:
Señora Doris Azucena lives in the small village of Cochaya, district of Salpo, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad. She is 39 years old and has 4 children that still depend on her. She was only able to complete her schooling through grade school.

Señora Doris started a business with the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her Communal Bank, "Virgin del Carmen". She works preparing cheeses and milk curd, partly with milk produced by her cattle and partly with milk that she buys from some people in her community. She sells her products to some wine cellars of different villages and also to a list of clients in the city of Trujillo that she has obtained through her time and dependability.

With the loan of 1,000 soles, which she will pay in 4 months, Doris will buy milk curd for making cheese and three rams to sell their meat. She will also buy concentrated feed for the cows.

Señora Doris is an associate of the "Eleodora Alfaro López" mothers’ club, where she has served previously as president and treasurer. Her dream is to have a small truck that she can use to transport merchandise to the different villages and to Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Doris Azucena vive en el poblado menor de Cochaya, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 39 años de edad, sólo estudió primaria completa y tiene 4 hijos que aún dependen de ella.

La señora Doris inicia un negocio con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Virgen del Carmen”. Ella se dedica a la preparación de quesos y cuajada, una parte con leche que produce su ganado y otra con leche que compra de algunos pobladores de su comunidad. Sus productos los vende en algunas bodegas de diferentes caseríos y también a una cartera de clientes en la ciudad de Trujillo que ha obtenido con el tiempo y la constancia.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará tres carneros para vender su carne y cuajada para hacer los quesos, también comparará concentrado para alimentar a las vacas.

La señora Doris es socia del club de madres “Eleodora Alfaro López”, anteriormente fue presidenta y tesorera. Su sueño es tener una camioneta para movilizarse con la de mercadería a los diferentes caseríos y a Trujillo.

loans.use: To buy small animals and concentrated animal food.

loans.name: Salome's Nguukazi Group

texts.en:
Salome, age 36, is married with 3 children (ages 18, 15, and 13). She has a business of selling food and materials at her shop. This shop opened in 2004 and she works there from 6am to 8pm daily. In a month, the shop brings her a profit of about $64.

In the past, Salome took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more inventory for her shop. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with Hamida who is a member in her loan group. Hamida owns a small grocery store.

loans.use: To buy stock in food and materials

loans.name: Saun

texts.en: Saun W. is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She sells shoes and she has been operating this business since 1997. She is a LAPO member. She requests the loan of $450 to enable her buy more shoes for sale

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Đình, 43 years old, lives with her husband and 5 children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She joins the TYM Fund 4 years ago. All the funds from the loans that she took out she invested in her grocery store. The business is convenient for the weekly payments and she has never been late on any payment. The incomes seem proportional to the loan amounts. She is applying for a loan of 650USD. Her current monthly income is 200-220USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Đình, 43 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ được 4 năm. Các vòng vốn trước chị Đình đều vay vốn đầu tư vào bán hàng tạp hóa. Đây là một công việc thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia chưa bao giờ chị Đình chậm trễ trong việc hoàn trả. Những lúc hàng bán chạy, thu nhập từ cửa hàng thường tỷ lệ thuận với mức vốn đầu tư. Chị Đình vừa làm đơn xin vay mức vốn 650USD để mua thêm hàng bán. Thu nhập hiện nay của cửa hàng là 200-220USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long N., age 34, is married and has four children. She stays at home during the day, looking after her children and cooking food for the entire family. After the housework is done, she earns about $1 a day raising pigs. Her husband works in construction, earning about $3 a day building houses. Two of their children are students, and two others are too young to attend the school.

To make more money to support her family, she has applied for a loan to buy piglets, which she will breed and sell when they are grown up.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en: Y. Sayora is 24 years old. She was born and lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married. Mrs. Y. Sayora has been raising livestock for 10 years, since she was a young girl and helped her mother taking care of the flock. Now Mrs. Y. Sayora is married and helps her husband with animal care and milk making. She trades the milk among the fellow villagers and at the local bazaar. Now Mrs. Y. Sayora applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one more milk cow.

loans.name: Leoncia's Group

texts.en:
Felicitas, Alejandra, and Leoncia are members of the Village Bank Huascahura.

Leoncia is married, 68 years old and has five children. Leoncia and her husband make handicrafts on the loom, such as tapestries, which they sell at the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Felicitas is married, 36 years old and has three children. Felicitas sells meat, cheese and young animals from house to house. She buys the animals at the fairs and they are very beneficial to her.

Alejandra is married, 56 years old, and has seven children. Alejandra and her husband buy cattle from different towns around the region and sell them in the fair at Ayacucho.

Felicitas, Alejandra, and Leoncia need loans of 600 soles, 300 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of pigs, sheep, cows, thread and dye.

Felicitas, Alejandra, and Leoncia's dreams are to better their businesses and that their children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, sheep, cows, thread and dye.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Jimmy is as 28 year old father of a small boy, and works as a taxi driver. He is the owner of 2 motorbikes with which he is able to support his family. Jimmy's goals is to be a responsible parent and to be able to offer his son an adequate education. Because of this, Jimmy wants to repair one of his motorbikes that is in disrepair. This is why Jimmy wants a loan, in order to buy replacement parts to fix his motorbike. In the future, Jimmy would like to open a shop that would be run by his wife. Let's help this father who demonstrates a desire to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Jimmy tiene 28 años y es padre de un pequeño niño, él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es propietario de dos motocarros con los cuales da el sustento diario a su hogar. La finalidad de Jimmy como todo padre responsable, es brindarle a su hijo una adecuada educación, por ello en motivo de su esfuerzo.Jimmy desea reparar uno de sus motocarros ya que se encuentra en un mal estado, para ello requiere del préstamo que aquí solicita, para comprar repuestos y algunas piezas que harán que funcione su herramienta de trabajo; aparte del sus motos, en adelante Jimmy quiere abrir una bodega que pueda ser administrado por su esposa. Apoyemos a este padre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts and fix his motorbike.

loans.name: Rameshwori

texts.en:
Rameshwori M. is a resident of Thecho.  Thecho is located in the Lalitpur district.  Most of the people in this area are engaged in farming.  Mrs. M. lives in a single family household with her husband and one daughter.  Her daughter is studying in primary school.

Together, Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Shyam M., opened their grocery shop three years ago in Thecho.  They sell different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on.  Now, Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs. 10000.00 loan to buy different types of grocery items for her business.

She would like to use her increased income to provide better education for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy different types of grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Samira's Tunasubra Group

texts.en:
Samira is 27 years and married with 2 children, aged 4 and 2. She has been a food seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 8.30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Samira is now looking for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Siti, who has a business dealing with cake and bread sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas”, ubicado en Jr. La Paz Mz. A Lt. 18 AA.HH. Violeta Correa del distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de ropa usada. Tiene 3 años trabajando con al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad, Juana continua con el mismo negocio de venta de ropa a domicilio y también cuenta con la venta de arroz, sal y fideos al por mayor. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 4 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de sal, 4 paquetes de fideos y ropa usada, ya que ese negocio le brinda mayores ganancias.
   
Juanita agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo y promete pagar puntualmente el préstamo que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the “Las Paykanas” communal bank, located at the address Jr. La Paz Mz A Lt. 18 AA.HH. Violeta Correa in the district of Yarinacocha, department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old, and is mother to 5 children who are still dependant on her. She is married and her husband earns a living in wood extraction. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 [US$100], she decided to invest in the sale of used clothing. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos communal bank for 3 years.

Currently Juana continues with the same business of selling clothing from house to house and also sells rice, salt and pasta.

With loan of S/.2,000 [US$650], which will be paid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of 4 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of salt, 4 packages of pasta and used clothing, since that business brings her the best earnings.

Juanita is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their support and promises to punctually pay for the loan granted her.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pasta, salt, rice in bulk.  Purchase of used clothing.

loans.name: Mrs. Bet You Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Bet Y., is 53, and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband Beong Thet is a driver who makes a small salary to help support his family.  Bet earns her living as a farmer who cultivates rice on 1-hectar field. She is facing a problE. on her plantation because her field is infertile, which produces bad crops. To solve this problE., is asking for a loan to purchase additional fertilizers to help make her field more productive. 

Bet is a village bank president of sixteen people who all live in Meun Trea Village in Kadal Province.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on KiV..

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field to make it more productive.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mr. Pha N. was born in 1970 and she now lives in Lvea Sar Kandal village in Kandal province.  He and his wife, Mrs. Phat Yoeurn, have 1.25-hectares of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  

On this plantation, they now cannot cultivate rice because they have insufficient rice seeds to cultivate.  To deal with this purpose, Mr. Pha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to plant.  He would use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support the field and make a better crop.  

Mr. Pha N. has six children, four of whom are attending the local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are at the ages of one month and four years old.  His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to plant.  He will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support the field and make a better crop.

loans.name: Naziran Hameed Masih Group

texts.en:
"My name is Naziran and I’m a 38-year-old married lady. I reside in a place called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it for the past 18 years. My husband's name is H. M. and he works as a cook in an army office. I’ve six kids: four sons and two daughters. My first two sons are daily wage laborers. The others don't have any work right now. My daughters help me sell milk. We get up early and milk the buffalo, then we transfer the milk into milk pots and go to the shops to sell milk. This work earns us Pak rupees 3000 per month. I am requesting a loan to expand my milk-selling business by buying another buffalo.

I am the group leader for two more women. Anayatan baji and Asia baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart to transport loads."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeun C. is a villager in Sras Pring village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 55-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in the local garment factory, while the others own a small grocery store in the local market. She is a rice middleman.

Mrs. Choeun C. is requesting a loan to buy more rice and grocery goods for her children's business. She hopes to increase their incomes and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice and grocery goods for her children's business, to help the whole family's income.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr: Mme Lydia T. est née le 24/04/1961 à Aného. Elle  est mariée et a quatre (04) personnes à charges. Elle réside actuellement à Aného avec sa famille. Cela fait déjà six (06) ans qu’elle exerce le commerce des produits alimentaires. Voulant transformer son commerce de produits alimentaires en un minimarket, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner en quantité enfin de pouvoir remplir la boutique qu’elle a prise soin de louer déjà. Des revenus qui découleront de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son crédit et faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lydia T. was born on April 24, 1961 in Aného. She is marrried and responsible for 4 persons. She is living in Aného with her family. For six years already, she has been selling foodstuffs. Wishing to change her little foodstuffs business into a mini-market, she is requesting this loan to stock up in greater quantity, so as to fill the little store that she has already rented. The income from her business will permit her to reimburse the loan and support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
Jane has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 10 years. She belongs to Amani group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 300. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to increase her sock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Jane is married and has three children: ages 21, 20 and 8. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Bupe, who has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Fouad has owned a cassette and CD shop since 2001.

Fouad has requested a loan of $1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. Fouad has been a microcredit client for seven years and has always paid on time. His previous loans have helped him to improve his business, as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Fouad chose his business because of his experience.

loans.use: Fouad will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is a 40-year-old mother of one child, 4-year-old James Maliki. Mary is a tailor who repairs clothes, sells fabric and makes uniforms for school children. She is asking for 20,000 KSH to buy a sewing machine and linens. She is happily married to her husband who runs a small cafeteria. She says she likes having just three in her family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and linens for her business

loans.name: Origama Candiru Zainabu Group

texts.en: C. Zainabu, age 38, lives with her partner. She has been making tablecloths since she was 15 years of age. She will use this loan to purchase thread for making tablecloths. She supplies tablecloths to the community and also the marketplace. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase thread for making tablecloths

loans.name: Gloria Concepción

texts.es: Gloria Concepción C. D. A. vive en el municipio D. Zaragoza departamento La Libertad , Gloria está felizmente casada y es madre D. una niña D. 9 años, Gloria cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo en los gastos familiares;  ya Erick trabaja como empleado público obteniendo un sueldo fijo mensual, pero Gloria también obtiene ingresos para la manutención D. la familia ya que tiene su propio negocio que inicio hace 8 años, vendiendo productos por catálogos y comprando mercadería como zapatos, perfumes y ropa .  El método D. comercialización D. Gloria es visitar personalmente a los clientes como a oficinas, universidades y vecinos.  Gloria solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar otra variedad D. productos y así surtir más su inventario
texts.en:
Gloria Concepción C. D. A. lives in the town of Zaragoza in the department of La Libertad. Gloria is happily married and is the mother of a nine-year-old girl. Gloria has the support of her husband in the household expenses. Erick works as a civil servant and receives a monthly fixed salary, but Gloria also earns income to support the family. She has her own business that she started 8 years ago selling products through catalogs and buying merchandise such as shoes, pefumes, and clothing. Gloria's marketing method is to personally visit her clients in offices or universities or go to her neighbors. Gloria is asking for this loan because she wants to buy another variety of products and, in this way, increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ngor

texts.fr: Ngor  est un boucher   , son étal  est au quartier zone résidentielle de Mbour, ville qui se trouve à quelques 70 km de Mbour. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Il fait ce métier depuis 7 ans .Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de nourrir sa famille et ses parents restés au village. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite un veut profiter de l’approche de l hivernage moment pendant lequel les moutons se vendent moins chers pour acheter quelques moutons.
texts.en:
Ngor is a butcher and he has a stall in the residential part of Mbour, a town about 70 km from Dakar. He is a married father with three children. He has been working as a butcher for seven years. The revenue generated by his work allows him to feed his family and his parents who stay in the village. With the loan that Ngor is requesting he wants to take advantage of the approaching rainy season when he can buy sheep at a lower price.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Salinah Chebet

texts.en: Salinah is married to Samuel Sitienei and they have three children. She runs a retail shop in Olare in Eldoret town. Salinah has serviced one loan from KADET and, with this new loan, she intends to buy two bags of sugar, four gallons of cooking fat and two bags of rice. She has been in her retail business for four years and hopes to provide more variety for her increasing clientele. In future, Salinah intends to buy a commercial plot, educate her children, and expand her retail shop to a wholesale shop. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat and othe household items

loans.name: Hồ Thị

texts.en:
L. Hồ Thị (1315040378) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four school-aged children.

L. owns and operates a service-based business, primarily providing cargo transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.


In 2007, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business. The loan will be her 5th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De (Benkadi  B  Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe 1 de l’association BENKADI B sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 24 hectares.
Après la récolte, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur place au village, dans le marché hebdomadaire de Marka-Coungo et à Fana, essentiellement au comptant, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group 1 of the association BENKADI B are married women who average 43 years of age and four children.  The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, a community seat of FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work.  Their businesses revolve around growing sorghum and peanuts.  The group members are on their fifth loan with the institution. All the preceding loans were repaid without any problems at all. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment.  And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 24 hectares.  After the harvest, part of their production is consumed at home.  The other part is sold locally to customers composed of men and women at the weekly market of Marka-Coungo and Fana in essentially cash transactions. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi A. sells fish and groceries like milk, Milo (a milk beverage), sugar and other food supplies. She buys the fish from the fishermen at the seashore and sells them at the market in Elmina. Naomi has received senior high education. She is a single parent with four children and is responsible for the upkeep of her family.

Naomi has been selling fish and groceries and so on since 1999. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell and also to buy more groceries to fill her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell and more groceries to fill her shop

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 56, a resident of Brangay Nungnungan Cauayan City, has raised hogs for almost 16 years, earning around PHP2 000 when she sells her livestock every four months. Currently raising four pigs, she is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to maintain the feed supply of her livestock.

Virginina is married to Ernesto G., a tricycle driver, and they have three children: Janice - 24 years old, a teacher, followed by Ernesto Jr. - 22 years old, college graduate, and Joey - 21 years old, studying at the college level. The entire family, including an adopted daughter, lives together happily. Virginia provides the main financial support for the family.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa D. C. sells movies in VCD and DVD formats as well as audio CDs in a small space in the market. She also sells RTW (ready-to-wear) dresses along with her CDs. Teresa is a 42-year-old woman living in Tala, Caloocan, City with her husband, Edwin (a businessman), and their four children. On a daily basis, her net income ranges from 200 PHP to 300 PHP. Teresa has been enjoying her business for nine years now and dreams of having a large boutique so she can employ the services of her friends.

Teresa has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2007. She is now on her fifth loan cycle and expects to receive her newest loan of 10,000 PHP so she can buy new movie titles to sell.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through a fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy new movie titles

loans.name: Mohammad Taqi Group

texts.en:
This is M. T. group and Fatima is the group leader of the group. The group is made up of three members and each of them would like to expand and progress their business. They have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.

Fatima is a tailor. She wants a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine because she has lots of problems with her old one.

Faranaz is a tailor and also is wonderful at knitting. She would like a loan to purchase the required materials in order to do good work.

Azatullah wants a loan for his car to buy a new machine for it.

They are all thankful to both AFS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Bless Smt Group

texts.en:
This picture is of Isatu K., Isatu F., Fatmata K. and Rugie K.. They call their group Bless SMT, in recognition of the good work that SMT (Salone Micro Finance Trust) has done. These women are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan of Le 500,000 to help them develop their businesses. With the help of this loan, their businesses will increase both in size and quality, attracting more customers so that sales will improve and profit will also increase; consequently, their standard of living will improve.

Isatu K. (second from right) is the leader of this group. She is approximately thirty-eight years of age. She is married and has three children. Isatu’s husband is retired and her children are attending schools. Two are in primary schools and one is in secondary school. Isatu sells dried fish at the market and sells cooked rice at one of the schools in Magburaka town. Isatu has been a businesswoman since childhood.

loans.use: investing in their businesses

loans.name: Pia Ilaria

texts.en:
Ms. Pia Ilaria C. C. spends 4 hours every day making bolos in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil, Ecuador. A "bolo" is like a Popsicle, but rather than on a stick, the frozen product comes inside a plastic tube.

Ms. C. makes 6 different bolo flavors: coconut, milk, chocolate, gum, tamarindo,and mulberry. She sells each bolo for 5 cents. Fortunately, there are many schools, churches and parks nearby, so she averages 200 clients daily. The treats are a favorite after-school snack for most of the neighborhood children!

Ms. C. is widow and a mother of three (one son still lives with her). She moved to Paraiso with few possessions after her home in Bastion (another town in Guayaquil) burned down.

Recently a thief broke in to Ms.C.' home/business and robbed her. Therefore, she is requesting a loan for bricks in order to secure her livelihood.

In the future Ms. C. would like to buy a mobile freezer in order to keep her bolos cold for street sales and during rolling blackouts.

loans.use: To buy bricks to secure her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, D. 50 años, es una mujer muy alegre; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Félix D. 53 años y con sus 5 hijos: Vilma D. 18, Juan D. 16, Carlos D. 12, Linda D. 9 y Paula D. 4 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios.

Junto a su inseparable canastita D. papa arrebozada, sale todos los días rumbo a su puesto D. venta. Ella venD. en la puerta D. la universidad D. su localidad. Su venta diaria es D. casi 300 papas arrebozadas, lo que le da los ingresos necesarios par mantener a su familia.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que le permite cuidar a su pequeña hija mientras sale a vender, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto en espera D. los clientes. 
Para más adelante, desea incursionar en el negocio D. la venta D. jugos D. quinua (bebida caliente hecha a base D. manzana licuada, maicena y quinua), pues es una bebida bastante demandada por las personas en su ciudad.

Este es el tercer préstamo D. Vilma con MFP y se siente en la capacidad D. pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta D. pertenecer. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosas papas rebosadas.
texts.en:
Vilma, 50 years old, is a very happy woman; she lives in her own house along with her husband Félix, who is 53 years old, and with her five children: Vilma, 18, Juan, 16, Carlos, 12, Linda, 9, and Paula, 4, who she hopes to give a good education to. Along with her inseparable basket of battered potatoes, she leaves each day headed for her sales stand. She works at the entrance of the university in her town. Her daily sales are almost 300 battered potatoes, which gives her the necessary income to support her family. What she likes most about her job is that is allows her to take care of her youngest daughter while she is working. She has been doing this job for 14 years and considers the most difficult part to be staying at her stand all day awaiting customers. In the future, she hopes to get into the business of selling quinoa juice (a hot drink maD. from blended apple, cornflour, and quinoa), since it is a drink in high demand by the people in her city. This is Vilma's third loan with MFP and she feels she will be able to pay it back on time since she trusts her business and her community bank, which she is very happy to belong to. With the 1,500 nuevos soles requested, she will buy new ingredients to prepare her delicious battered potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of her dish

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is the owner of a grocery store in Gaza city, Palestine. Maher is 33 years old, married, and the father of five children. To grow his business, he would like to put money into his store. The profits derived from his business will enable him to better meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies of groceries for resale

loans.name: Tamana Abdull Zaher Group

texts.en:
The Tamana A. Zaher group has four members: Roogull, Tamana, Farid Ahmad and Hayat Bibi. They all live in Kabul, Afghanistan. Roogull is the group leader of Tamana A. Zaher group. She is married and she lives in a family that has five members. She wants to take a loan for her son. He is a mechanic and he has been involved in this business for more then four years. He wants to buy some tools for his shop with this loan.  

The second member of the Tamana A. Zaher group is Tamana, who is busy with bead working.  She wants to buy a new machine for her business with this loan.

The third member of this group is Farid Ahmad, who has a general store and wants to complete his stock with this loan.

The last member, Hayat Bibi, wants to take a loan for her husband. He has a fresh fruit cart and with this loan he wants to buy more fruit for his cart.   

They all have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani to expand their businesses and complete their requirements. 

They would like to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more materials for their businesses

loans.name: Gustave

texts.en:
Gustave is 23 years old. He is single and he cares for three dependents from his family. He lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda, in the village called Gakenke, where his business is located. This province is a tourism region, the location of Volcanoes National Park, home to the famed mountain gorillas.

Gustave has a retail shop where he sells different kinds of products such as cosmetics, toilet paper, water, and toothpaste. He prefers this business because can use his own house in his business, which is a great opportunity for him. His business is very organized. He employs one person as a helper so that his business runs smoothly. Gustave has been in this field for three years. The hours of his shop are from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM every day, even on the weekend.

Gustave is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods at a good price to attract more customers. After this target is reached, Gustave will be able to serve more customers and earn more profits, which will allow him to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 52 years old, married and has 5 adult children. Dionesia owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of fish. Dionesia has been running her business for 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Dionesia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.
 
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase stock and provide working capital for her fish selling business

loans.name: Osman Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Osman es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y dependen de él. Osman tiene su actividad que es una pulpería, en donde ofrece los productos diarios y aquí sus clientes recurren a comprar los alimentos diarios básicos. El dio inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue una alternativa de vida para él y su familia pues no tiene un trabajo estable y quería encontrar la manera de ayudarle a su esposa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias prima. Su meta principal es incrementar su negocio y obtener otra fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Osman is married and has 3 small children who are dependent on him. Osman has a business, a grocery store, where he offers products for daily use. His regular clients come to buy their basic daily food items. He started the business 6 years ago, and it's worth noting that it represented an opportunity in his life because he did not have a stable job and wanted to find a way to help his wife. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials. His main goal is to grow the store and acquire an additional source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gbampor Group

texts.en: This group of entrepreneurs calls their group 'Gbampor'. Sonie K. is the group’s leader. She is 40-year-old and born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have 5 children – two are in secondary school and three are already grown-ups. Sonie sells rice, beans and palm oil. She has been a businesswoman for 2 years. With this loan, Sonie will improve her business by buying bags of rice and beans and gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and beans and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha Cecilia Díaz tiene 44 años, está separada y es madre de tres hijos de 21, 15 y 13 años. Vive en el barrio Compartir La Margarita en el suroccidente de Bogotá, cerca del Portal de las Américas, estación terminal del TransMilenio, concepto bogotano de transporte que combina aspectos de los sistemas de metro con los de bus y significa que uno puede desplazarse rápido a otras partes de la ciudad. En este barrio tiene su negocio de producción y comercialización de dotaciones llamado “Dotaciones Macedy” que inició hace alrededor de 7 años. Durante los últimos 5 años ha venido capacitándose y en la actualidad se dedica completamente a la confección.
Este es su segundo crédito y con el anterior compró una máquina plana y una fileteadora que le han permitido producir generar más utilidad en el negocio. El crédito que ahora solicita lo quiere invertir en materia prima, insumos  y una mesa de corte. Manifiesta que uno de sus desafíos más grandes, es la falta de una mesa de corte ya que tiene que irse donde una amiga para cortar y desde ahí volver con el trabajo a su taller. Más adelante, sueña con agrandar su taller para dar trabajo a otras madres cabezas de familia.
texts.en:
Martha Cecilia Díaz is 44 years old, is separated, and is the mother of three children, ages 21, 15, and 13. She lives in the Compartir La Margarita neighborhood in the southwestern part of Bogotá. Her home is near the Portal de las Américas, the terminus station of the TransMilenio—a Bogotan concept in transportation that combines aspects of metro systems with those of buses and which makes it possible to travel quickly to different parts of the city. Her dressmaking shop is also located in this neighborhood—her business is called “Dotaciones Macedy”, and she started it about 7 years ago. During the last 5 years she was training and she is currently making a living entirely from dressmaking. This is Martha’s second loan. She used her previous loan to purchase a sewing machine and an overlock stitching machine, which made it possible for her to generate more profits in her business. She wants to invest her current loan in raw materials, supplies, and a cutting table. She says that one of her biggest challenges is not having a cutting table, since she has to go to a friend’s shop to cut cloth and then go back to work at her own shop. In the longer term, her dream is to expand her shop so that she can provide jobs for other mothers who are supporting families.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in raw materials for dressmaking, such as fabric, thread, and a cutting table

loans.name: God Come First Group

texts.en: Yassah S. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Come First Group. She is 61 years old, is married, and has three children whose ages range from 15 to 27 years. Yassah did not have the opportunity to go to school. In the photo, she is the one holding the sign. For fourteen years Yassah has been selling general goods and foodstuffs at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia. She has good pricing and renders good service to her customers which makes them keep returning. She usually faces problems with the rainy season because, when it rains, people don’t come out to buy. Yassah started selling with money she borrowed from her family. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more general goods and foodstuffs. Her goal is to build a store for her business and to improve her family’s living conditions. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more general goods and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Myadagmaa

texts.en:
Myadagmaa is 36 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house. Her daugther, Tsendsuren, is 14 years old and attends a local secondary school. Her husband is a working engineer in a company. 

During the day, Myadagmaa operates an underwear-trading business at a local market called Narantuul. For her retail business, she purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. She started her business in 1999 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (about $36). After years of successful operations, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 2,000,000 tugrugs (about $1,445) today.

Myadagmaa has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She says, “I would like to provide a good education for my daughter.” She is requesting a loan to purchase a large amount of underwear to sell to her many customers.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Lucio Salvador

texts.es: Lucio Salvador M. de 31 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San salvador, junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad. El es un padre de familia muy responsable quien posee su negocio propio en el cual ha luchado mucho para sostenerlo, y de esta manera siempre poder aportar sin falta a su hogar. Lucio se dedica a la reparación de relojes y al mantenimiento de estos, haciendo trabajos como cambiar piezas, o cambiar la batería de estos. Así mismo comercializa brazaletes y pines para relojes, el negocio esta ubicado en el centro de San Salvador a las afueras de una comercial muy conocida, lo que le permite estar con contacto con más personas. A pesar que su negocio es pequeño logra obtener ganancias diarias las cuales son muy aceptables, es por esta razón que Lucio desea comprar diferentes tipos de brazaletes para reloj en variedad de colores y estilos, así mismo comprar más baterías y toda la herramienta necesaria para el mantenimiento y reparación de estos. Lucio solita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda lograr todo esto, teniendo el deseo de crecer en su negocio y poder contar con una vida estable y mejor.
texts.en:
Lucio Salvador M., 31, lives in San Salvador department with his wife and two children who are 7 and 9 years of age. He’s a very responsible father who owns his own business; it’s been a struggle to keep it but he always hopes to be able to support his family through it. Lucio repairs and services watches, he replaces parts and batteries, for example. He also sells watch bands and watch band springs. The business is located in downtown San Salvador outside a very well known store which exposes it to more potential customers. Despite his business being very small he manages to earn daily profits that are acceptable. For this reason, he wants to buy different kinds of watch bands in a variety of styles and colors as well as buy more watch batteries and the necessary tools to repair watches. Lucio is asking Integral for a loan that will make all the above possible wishing his business grow thereby having a more stable and better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Battery and watch repair accessories.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Las Margaritas, es un grupo que se compone de miembros que están trabajando día a día para mejorar sus vidas a pesar de las dificultades que deben enfrentar. Ellos viven en la comunidad de Tlapala a las orillas del centro de Chalco, en la ciudad de México. Un grupo integrado por cinco mujeres, decidieron que su grupo se llamara así ya que a ellas les gustan las flores en especial las margaritas por que son lindas. Ellas se sienten a gusto con cada integrante ya que para este grupo es importante el apoyo mutuo que se pueden brindar.

Candelaria B. García  de 49 años, orgullosamente originaria del estado de Oaxaca, con   un esposo que trabaja de albañil y con cuatro hijos ya mayores tres de ellos ya casados y uno soltero. Ella se ha dedicado a las ventas desde hace 20 años, ya que es una persona  a la cual le preocupa su familia y por ayudar a sus padres quienes aun viven en Oaxaca. Candelaria se dedicaba a la venta de comidas pero tuvo que dejar de vender por cuestiones enfermedad, así que decidió emprender un nuevo negocio que no implicara mucho trabajo y comenzó con la venta de productos de limpieza como: fibras, clara sol, pino, cubetas, tinas, sosa, etc. La gente que le compra dice que la atención que brinda es muy buena y siguen comprándole. Los planes que ella quiere alcanzar es poder poner un local fijo para tener sus productos para que no se le maltraten y poder tener un poco mas surtido y arreglar un poco mas su casa.

Los demás integrantes son: Angélica F. Hernández (Venta de abarrotes y cremería), Adela Victoria C. (Venta de pollo)  Teresa M. S. (venta de frutas y legumbres) y María Elena L. (Tienda) y aunque es un grupo pequeño los deseos de superarse son enormes y quieren invertir  para así tener un ingreso mas .
texts.en:
Las Margaritas ("The Daisies") is a group made up of members who are working daily to improve their lives despite the difficulties they must face. They live in the Tlapala community on the banks of the centre of Chalco, in Mexico City. A group of five women, they decided that their group would be called Las Margaritas because they like flowers, especially daisies, because they are beautiful. They each feel comfortable with each other, as the mutual support they offer each other is important. Candelaria B. G., 49, is proud to be from the state of Oaxaca. Her husband works as a mason and they have four grown children, three of whom are married and one who is single. She has sold merchandise for 20 years, as she is a person who looks after her family and helps her parents, who still live in Oaxaca. Candelaria used to sell food, but had to stop because of illness, so she decided to learn a new business that would not require much work. She started selling cleaning products like: fibers, Clarasol, pine, buckets, tubs, sodas, etc. The people who buy her products say that her service is very good and they continue to buy. She wants to have a fixed location to sell her products, so that she is not mistreated and can have a little more stock, and can fix up her house a little more. The other members are: Angélica F. Hernández (grocery and dairy products sales), Adela Victoria C. (chicken sales), Teresa M. S. (fruit and vegetable sales) and Maria Elena L. (store). Since it is a small group their desire to improve is enormous and they want to invest in order to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soap, eggs, refreshments, cream, ham, chicken, buckets, bleach, cloth, pine, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es: Juan David, tiene 37 años, es soltero y es natural de Huambutio. Actualmente, el socio trabaja en el gobierno regional como albañil, el trabaja desde el mes de Julio del 2009 hasta hoy día. Antes el trabaja en el INC como obrero de investigación. Su actividad económica complementaria es dirigir un grupo musical llamado “Los Devis”. Ya son dos años que tiene el grupo musical y le va muy bien. El socio requiere el  préstamo para comprar un amplificador que cuesta S/. 1,800. El pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio”. Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Juan David is 37 years old, single, and a native of Huambutio. Currently, he works with the regional government as a bricklayer. He has been working for them since July 2009. Before, he worked with the INC as an investigative construction worker. His complementary job is directing a musical group called, Los Devis. This group has been together now for two years and it is going very well. He is seeking a loan so that he can purchase an amplifier that costs S/. 1,800. He is a member of the communal bank, Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio. He has been a participant for the past two years and it is going quite well for him.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an electronic device.

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.en: Paulina C. is from the village of Upper Disakan. She is 52 years old. Paulina is the group leader of six-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Paulina is married. To make a living, Paulina buys and sells fish. Paulina has been engaged in her business for more than 29 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Paulina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Paulina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish-selling business

location.town: Liloy-Upper Disakan, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Clive Road  Women's Group B-Jinja

texts.en: If you carry yourself around with the courage of your convictions and confidence in tow, you are likely to make head way in whatever you get your hands on or in whatever business you bear a hand in. At least that is the reality 40 year old Z. Kate has been in touch with for the past 10 years in her clothes sells business in Jinja. She exemplified all the above qualities at the threshold of her business 10 years ago. The business was thrown into gear with a loan she got, combined with savings from her former poultry business. Hard work, perseverance and determination she says have been her stocks in trade. Her business at present generates for her 60,000 shillings on a weekly basis as profits. With this loan, she wants to buy more bales of clothes for resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more bales of clothes for resell both new and second hand clothes.

loans.name: Sarah Joy

texts.en:
Sarah Joy P. is from the village of Pinamulan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 26 years old. Sarah Joy is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Sarah Joy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Sarah Joy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sarah Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sarah Joy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Sarah Joy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Comlanvi

texts.fr: ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d'un genre particulier qui est le commerce de produits cosmétiques. il fait ce commerce dans sa propre boutique. sa clientèle est exclusivement composée de femmes. il réalise de bonnes recettes. la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 11 cartons de pharmapur, 5 cartons de savons de beauté, 3 cartons de lotion de beauté, 7 cartons de pâtes dentifrices et divers.
texts.en:
This gentleman makes a living selling cosmetics. He works in his own store. His clientele is solely made up of women. He has a good income. Since his merchandise is currently in high demand, he came to WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 11 boxes of pharmapur soap, 5 boxes of beauty soap, 3 boxes of beauty lotion, 7 boxes of toothpaste and a few other items.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mr. Kong S., 63, and his wife, Mrs. Sarum Chea, 59, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1975 and have six children: five sons and one daughter. All of them are married and live outside the family home.

Kong has been a carpenter for six years and his wife has been selling finished silk fabric for two years. Kong is requesting his first loan of $500 to repair a machine he uses in his carpentry business and help provide capital for his wife to buy finished silk fabric for resale.
