loans.use: To repair a machine used in his carpentry business and to provide capital for his wife to buy finished silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Rigoberto Dionel

texts.es:
Rigoberto Dionel Barragán L. tiene 41 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 10, 6, y 4 anos.  

Rigoberto es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Isidro, que está ubicada a una hora y media de San Miguel. Son 10 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y trigo.
Rigoberto se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva el maíz, el trigo, el fríjol, la arveja, y las papas. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en San Pablo, el centro comercial mas cerca de la comunidad, cada 8 días. 

Solicita el credito para comprar una baca de leche y comprar los abonos agrícolas. El préstamo lo ayudara en aumentar su producción agrícola. En los proximos anos espera aumentar su producion agrícola. Las lanchas han afectado mucho sus cultivos de maíz y trigo este ano. Se afecta mas los cultivos arriba de la comunidad por la altura mas alto, donde se han perdido mas de 50% de la cosecha. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el boli.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 41 years old, married, and lives in the canton of San Miguel, province of Bolivar.  He has 3 children, ages 10, 6, 4.

Rigoberto is a member of the San Isidro rural bank, located 1 1/2 hours from San Miguel.  There are 10 members in total, who in the majority cultivate corn and wheat.  Rigoberto is also a farmer.  He plants corn, wheat, beans, peas, and potatoes.  Every 8 days, he makes his purchases and sells his produce in San Pablo, the commercial center nearest his community

Rigoberto is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow and agricultural fertilizers.  The loan will help him to increase his agricultural production, which, in the next few years, he hopes to augment.

Bad conditions have greatly affected his corn and wheat crops this year, especially in fields above the community at the highest altitude, where more than 50% of the crops have been lost.

In his free time Rigoberto likes to play 'boli' (boliche, a traditional game).

loans.use: BUYING A COW AND FERTILIZER FOR AGRICULTURE

loans.name: John Kipkorir

texts.en:
John Kipkorir M. is 39 years old and married to Joan Cherop M., a farmer and provider of an additional source of income for the family. The couple has two school-going children. They live in Soy, Eldoret, Kenya. John has been operating a general store for the past six years and earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES.
John learnt about Kiva partner, KADET, through marketing carried out in his area. He is applying for his first loan of 49,500 KES from KADET, which he intends to use to buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, 5 bags of sugar, 10 bundles of baking flour and any other stock that he needs. With the anticipated profits, he plans to expand his business.
In the future, John hopes to have a wholesale business, as these have proved to be very profitable in the area. His deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 16 boxes of cooking oil, 5 bags of sugar and 10 bundles of baking flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food and charcoal.

loans.name: Wasty Leydie

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a 39 ans. Pour participer au menage, elle fait la vente de chemise, sacs de sortie dame, chausure, maïs et igname. Ell achète  au grand marché de Lomé et revend à agbaléfedo. Elle cumule 5 ans dans cette acctivité. Avec le credit sollicité, elle compte accroitre sa mage beneficiaire.
texts.en: This woman is married and the mother of two. She is 39 years old. In order to help support her family, she sells shirts, ladies’ handbags, shoes, corn and yams. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells in Agbaléfedo. She has five years of experience. With the loan she is seeking she hopes to increase her revenue margin.

loans.use: Purchasing shirts, shoes and miscellaneous items

loans.name: Namutamala Women's Group - Mpigi

texts.en:
Thirt-four-year-old Vincent K., who radiates gentleness, humility and steadfastness, has had a metal-shop business at his home in Mpigi for seven years. Self-motivation was the underlying factor behind the start-up of this enterprise. Prior to that, Vincent, who is married with four children, says he was more partial to farming. He still has a hand in his farming business but he says it is now more of a second fiddle means of subsistence. 

He is also taking a long view as he says he wants to expand his business even further. Monthly, this metal-shop business generates profits to the tune of 200,000 shillings. With this loan, Vincent, who is affiliated with the Namutamala Women's Group - Mpigi, says he is going to purchase more metal products for reselling.

loans.use: The purchase of more metal products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice, beans, pepper, salt, seasoning etc.

loans.name: Kamuli Road Twekalangule - Jinja Group

texts.en:
50-year-old K. Annet says she set forth in her current grocery store enterprise after the demise of her husband. She was at her wits end, and coming to grips with her predicament was the turning point. With 12 kids to provide welfare for, Annet knew she had to do something to bring substantial value to their lives. What exacerbated her situation from the start is the fact that she did not have any prior business experience. But, with conviction, she conquered the odds stacked against her. 

The grocery business has now lasted five years. It is located along Kamuli Road which is near the Jinja metropolis. She has mostly been selling fruits and vegetables. She says her weekly profits are to the tune of 180,000 shillings. With this loan, Annet, a member of the Kamuli Road Twekalangule Group, says she is going to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. She envisages better prospects for her business in the future. Now that the Christmas festive season is in the offing, she says she is looking forward to a roaring trade selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica de 33 años, tiene un negocio de un poco surtido en donde vende artículos de papelería y tiene un centro de servicios para llamadas telefónicas.  

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada suburbio ha vivido trabajando Verónica porque es una mujer trabajadora con ayuda de su esposo para solventar los gastos del hora ya que ellos tienen dos hijos. En la actualidad ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h00pm atendiendo su negocio mientras que su esposo vende mercadería. 

Quiere seguir trabajando para darle una buena vida a sus hijos por eso quiere comprar el préstamo papelería, artículos, recargas para llamadas. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos sigan trabajando y seguir teniendo ella y su esposo ingresos estables.
texts.en: Verónica, age 33, has a business where she sells stationery, and she has a service center for telephone calls. She lives in a periurban zone called Suburbio. She works a lot because she is a hard-working woman. Her husband helps her to cover their household costs, as they have two children. She currently works from 8:00 am to 11:00 pm tending to her business while her husband sells merchandise. She wants to keep working to give her children a better life, so she wants to use the loan to purchase stationery, articles and phone credit. In the future, she wants her children to keep working, and for her and her husband to maintain a stable income.

loans.use: phone call refills, stationery

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya N. lives in the Kawempe Bubajjwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Lukiya has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Lukiya sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Lukiya has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, and sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Lukiya include thieves and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel. Lukiya lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and irish potatoes.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai K., 47 years old, is a humble villager living in the province of Kompong Tom. He is blessed with two school-aged children. His wife sells vegetables in the busy market. To earn a living, Tai K. also sells many kinds of vegetables which he buys in bulk from his supplier for a reasonable price.

He always sells his vegetables in a mobile way by using his old motorbike. Unfortunately, his existing motorbike has often broken down during use. Because of that, Tai K. has decided to seek a loan of $700 from Kiva which he will use to replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a widow.  She lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. This was a difficult time for her, but she recovered her senses and started work in order to raise her 4 children. She does stitching for her neighboring clients to fulfill the basic needs of the family. She couldn’t provide education to her children due to poor financial conditions.
Robina lives with her brother and cousin, who have a scrap business. They take orders from different factories and other scrap dealers and complete them to earn profits. 
Robina  also does her responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very responsible person and tries to give comfort to her brother, cousin and children by cooking food and cleaning the home. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy scrap, like used papers, plastic bottles and iron, in larger quantity.  That should enable him to complete the orders on time and to earn bigger profits. 
Robina is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 3rd loan application.  In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Robina”.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; la socia tiene 43 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, perfumes entre otros ella trabaja con las líneas Avon, Esika y Unique, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" [Together and United], located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  

She is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  She works selling beauty products like creams, colognes, and perfumes.  She works with brands like Avon, Esika, and Unique.  She has had a good time with this business, which has provided both personal and economic satisfaction for her.  She is a happy person with a drive to succeed.

Luisa is asking for this loan to purchase more products in order to have more variety to offer her customers.  

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products like creams, colognes, and perfumes

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa F. is married to a farmer and together they live with their 5 dependents. She buys palm fruits and processes it into palm oil for sale at Frami, near Abura in Cape Coast. She has been in this business for 11 years. Yaa uses her income to assist her husband to take care of her family. Yaa will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to produce more oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to reinvest back into her business for further growth. In this picture, Yaa is in the process of extracting the oil from the palm fruits.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits to produce oil for sale

loans.name: Adela Maria

texts.es: Adela Maria tiene su negocio que es la venta de rosquillas, cacao, semilla de jícaro. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, por lo que ha sido muy satisfactorio para su negocio. Con mucho esfuerzo propio ha logrado salir adelante en su actividad, pues conoce a sus clientes muy bien y se encuentra muy contenta con su medio de vida. En las afueras de vivienda, se encuentra ubicado su negocio a orillas de la carretera. Este financiamiento es para la compra de rosquillas, cacao, dulces, pinol, semilla de jícaro, bolsas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Adela Maria has a business selling donuts, cacao, and “semilla de jícaro” (a cold beverage made with milk, sugar, rice, and spices). This is not the first time that she has requested loans since they have been satisfactory for her business. With great effort, Adela was able to move forward with her activities. She knows her customers very well and is pleased to earn her livelihood in this manner. Her business is located outside of her home, next to the highway.

This loan will be used to purchase donuts, cacao, candy, “pinolillo” (a beverage made of corn and cacao), “semilla de jícaro”, bags, and other products.

loans.use: To purchase donuts, cacao, candy, “pinolillo”, “semilla de jícaro”, bags, and other products.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es: El señor José Efraín comienza a construir su vivienda que será el patrimonio que ofrezca a sus dos hijos. Poco a poco ha estado levantando su casa con ahorros que ha juntado con el largo de los años. El, su esposa y sus dos hijos por lo pronto viven en una casa prestada desde hace 5 años, el tiempo que le ha llevado para terminar su proyecto. El deseo mas grande de el es terminar su casa lo mas pronto posible para llevar a su familia a su nuevo hogar que será propio. Para realizar su anhelo el necesita capital para comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Mr. José Efraín started to build his home which will be the inheritance that he will leave for his two children.  He has been building his house little by little using the savings that he had accumulated through many years. He, his wife and their two children have been living in a rented house for the last five years, the time that it has taken him to finish his project.  His biggest wish is to finish his house as soon as possible and be able to to take his family to their own home.  To reach his goal he needs capital to buy materials and pay the laborers.

loans.use: to complete the construction on his home.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Teresa de Jesus J., ella tiene la edad de 28 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor juanque trabaja en el campo de jornalero, ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria de la comunidad.

Doña teresa nos platica que hace un poco mas de dos años y medio decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos.
ella vende antojitos mexicanos(tostadas, gorditas, empanadas, tacos, chiles rellenos) en su casa los dias sabados por la noche, y el resto de la semana vende cosmeticos y perfumeria con sus amigas y vecinas de la cominidad. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de jitomates, chiles, cebolla, carne, tortillas, maiz, frijol, platanos, huevos aceite y gas para la preparacion de sus antojitos y catalogos, cosmeticos y perfumeria.
ella espera que con esta invercion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle una mejor calidad vida a sus hijos y en un futo poder poder pagar su universidad.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca, there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec which has a very large lake that provides a lot of fish and work every year.  It is also well known because the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam is located there.  Teresa de Jesus J. lives in this community.  She is 28 years old, studied up to the third year of high school, and is married to Juan who works in the fields as a day laborer.  They have two children who attend a local elementary school.

Teresa tells us that, a little over two and a half years ago, she decided to start working in her own business so that she could help her husband with their household expenses and pay for their children's education.

Teresa sells Mexican snacks (tostadas, gorditas, empanadas, tacos and stuffed chili peppers) from her home on Saturday evenings.  The rest of the week she sells cosmetics and perfumes to her friends and neighbors in the community.  She needs this loan to invest in buying tomatoes, chili peppers, onion, meat, tortillas, corn, beans, plantains, eggs, oil and gas for making her snacks.  She also needs to buy catalogs, cosmetics and perfumes.

Teresa hopes that, with this investment, her business will prosper since she would like to provide her children with a better quality of life and, in the future, she would like to be able to pay for their university studies.

loans.use: to sell perfumes, cosmetics and Mexican snacks

loans.name: Maria Fidencia

texts.es:
María tiene  33 años de edad, está casada y vive en casa propia en el caserío Chica Alta del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. María es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. Ella desea arduamente mejorar su calidad de vida.

María se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral (gallinas y pavos) y  ganado ovino. Estas actividades las realiza en la parte trasera de su casa. María sabe que darles la mejor crianza a sus animales traerá buenos resultados en sus comercializaciones. Es por ello que, María, les da todos los cuidados necesarios para que estos crezcan en condiciones óptimas.

María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que usará para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus aves y de su ganado ovino. 

Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, married, and she lives in a house of her own in the community of Chicha Alta in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. Maria is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She wants very much to improve the quality of her life.

Maria raises poultry (chicken and turkeys) and sheep. She has her business in the rear part or her property. Maria knows that raising her livestock well will yield good results at the time of sale. That is why Maria provides them with all of the care they need for them to develop in optimal conditions.

Maria requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for her poultry and sheep.

She will be very happy if she would receive a loan because it will help her to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a married man and has one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past 4 years, Kenneth has been operating a computer shop, where he repairs computers. His potential customers are cyber cafe operators. He faces a major challenge in high competition and the high cost of purchasing spare parts. Kenneth dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With this loan for 60,000 Kshs, Kenneth wants to purchase computer spare parts for his shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy computer spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de librería y también el socio trabaja en construcción realizando acabados y pinturas para las construcción de casas y el negocio de librería lo realiza su esposo y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de librería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de librería como cuadernos, lapiceros, libros y lápices para la librería.
                                                   
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 26 years old, lives with his partner, and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his stationery store business.  He also works in construction, doing finishing work and painting houses.  His wife works in the stationery store and together they get their children ahead in life.

The borrower would like to expand his stationery store business.  He is requesting this loan to buy stationery products such as composition books, pens, books and pencils.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy stationery products such as composition books, pens, books and pencils for his stationery store

loans.name: Chepngeno

texts.en:
Chepngeno is a mother of 2 children, aged 5 and 2. She runs a farm in her matrimonial home of Kabianga-Litein, South Rift, Kenya. Her milk product is sold to the local market, and her tea is sold to the Kenya Tea Development Authority factory.

Chepngeno has requested a loan of 52,333 KES from  Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income generated will be used to repay the loan and later on to educate her children. She also wants to construct a modern dairy unit for her animals.

Chepngeno sees the lack of animal feed and knowledge of handling dairy farming as her main challenges.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Caacupe Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a la señora María, ya que ella había oído hablar de programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y quedo entusiasmada con la idea, así que organizo a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surgió el comité. Ellas se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo, con 12 integrantes.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace muchos años. Gracias a eso ha logrado formar una grupo de clientes bien definido. Ella manifiesta que es muy buena cocinera, y que su comida gusta mucho, por lo que tiene mucha demanda.
La Cliente se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Ella desea alguna día tener un lugar mas amplio donde poder ofrecer sus alimentos. Ella solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos para la elaboración de sus alimentos, como ser carnes, huevos, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
The formation of this committee began thanks to Señora María. She had heard of an entrepreneurial women’s program and was enthusiastic about the idea. So she organized her friends and neighbors and there the committee emerged.

Señora María has made a living selling food for many years. Thanks to that she has been able to establish a very defined group of customers. She states that she is a very good cook and that her food is very tasty, which is why it is in high demand. 

The client defines herself as a hardworking woman and a fighter. She hopes one day to have a bigger location where she would be able to offer her food. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making her food such as meat, eggs and seasonings, among others.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, eggs and other supplies.

loans.name: Elma Mabel

texts.es:
Elma de 60 años de edad, vive con unos familiares en su casa propia, cuenta con servicios sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y turística.

Desde algunos años Elma se dedica a la comercialización de animales (cerdos, gallinas y pavos), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades de su casa.  También cuenta con otro negocio de preparación y venta de comida, en cual cuenta con clientela fija.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar de alimentos balanceados, utensilios, sillas e insumos para seguir preparando la comida que ofrece a su clientela, al mejorar su servicio, obtendrá más ganancias para pagar el crédito brindado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Elma todos los días con optimismo y muchas ganas de seguir saliendo adelante, trabaja para tener mejoras económicas y más comodidades.
texts.en:
Elma, age 60, lives with family members in her own home. They only have electricity. The home is located in the Chepen district, belonging to the La Libertad department. This zone's economic activities are agriculture, livestock and tourism.

For several years Elma has sold animals (hogs, hens and turkeys). She raises them in corrals which are located in the back of her house. She feeds them balanced food and natural grains. Once they are grown, she sells them to her clients or in the different markets of the zone. With her income, she is able to cover her household necessities. She also has another business where she prepares and sells food. This business has a fixed customer base.

She has requested a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of balanced food, utensils, chairs and supplies to continue preparing the food that she offers to her customers. In improving her service, she will obtain more income to pay off this loan, and improve her quality of life. Elma starts off every day with optimism and a great desire to continue getting ahead. She works in order to have a better economic situation and more comforts.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed, utensils, chairs and supplies to continue preparing the food that she sells.

loans.name: Mirna De La Paz

texts.es:
Mirna, es comerciante D. ropa y prendas D. oro, es casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 12, 16 y 9 años D. edad, el negocio lo atienD. desD. hace 8 años, lo fundaron junto a su esposo, trabaja D. 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. blusas, short, ropa interior para niños y adultos, esta solicitud se debe a  la necesidad D. mantener en el negocio la suficiente mercadería, para atender las demandas D. los clientes.
Para ella su principal objetivo es trabajar por sus hijos, cubrir sus gastos D. educación, y apoyarlos para que puedan tener mejores oportunidades D. desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mirna sells clothes and gold jewelry, is married, and lives with her husband and three children, ages 12, 16, and 9.  For 8 years she has tended to the business which she founded with her husband.  She works from 7:00am to 5:00pm.
She requests a loan to buy blouses, shorts, and underwear for children and adults.  This request is due to the need to maintain sufficient merchandise for her customer’s demands.
For her, the main objective is to work for her children, cover their educational expenses, and support them so that they may have better opportunities for development.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shorts, and underwear for children and adults.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, 46 years old and married, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a rice farm in the Philippines for 30 years and also earns an income from a sari-sari store.

Having received and repaid four previous loans from NWTF, Lolita is now requesting a PHP 13000 loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Deicy Leany

texts.es:
Desde hace 9 años Deicy Leany se ha dedicado a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos, y conocidos, labor que le ha permitido generar ingresos para su hogar. Sin embargo actualmente enfrenta dificultades económicas, lo que le ha impedido el progreso de su negocio y sus ganancias ya que no cuenta con capital para comprar la mercancía que sus clientes solicitan, y es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un crédito, el cual invertirá en surtido de mayor variedad y cantidad, ya que así generará mas utilidades y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida mejorará. 

Deicy sueña con un mejor futuro, y día a día trabaja con la motivación de hacer este sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Deicy Leany has been selling merchandise to her family, friends and acquaintances for nine years. This work has allowed her to generate income for her household. Nevertheless, she is currently facing economic difficulties that have impeded the progress of her business and her earnings, as she does not have enough capital to buy the merchandise that her customers request. This is why she is now requesting a loan, which she will invest in stocking a greater variety and quantity of merchandise. This way, she will generate more profits and her quality of life will improve proportionately.

Deicy dreams of a better future and day by day, she is motivated to work to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of merchandise

loans.name: Narynbek

texts.ru:
Нарынбеку 51 год, женат и имеет 5 детей. Нарынбек по специальности экономист и вел свою трудовую деятельность с 1976 года по 1992 в местном колхозе.  Широкий кругозор отца и его активная и плодотворная деятельность вдохновили детей Нарынбека на получение высшего образования:  двое из его детей – дочь Жаныл и сын Кутман стали экономистами,  еще два сына – Азамат, Жаманак и дочь Аида стали дипломированными филологами.  
В связи с распадом системы колхозов, Нарынбек решил  начать свой собственный бизнес в животноводстве.  Настойчивый и упорный Нарынбек сумел развить свое хозяйство с численностью скота  в 10 коров, 7 лошадей, 6 овец и 5 коз на сегодняшний день.  Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Нарынбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на которые планирует закупить двух жеребцов. Доходы от кредита Нарынбек частично вложит в покупку дома, тем самым помогая дочери в приобретении собственного жилья. В будущем, Нарынбек планирует дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Narynbek is 51 years old, married and has five children.  He is an economist by profession and spent his working career from 1976 through 1992 at the local collective farm.  Their father's vision and his active and fruitful work inspired Narynbek's children to obtain a higher education.  Two of his children - daughter Janyl and son Kutman became economists, and two other sons, Azamat and Jamanak, and daughter Aida became certified linguists.  Due to the fall of the collective farm system. Narynbek decided to start his own business of animal husbandry.  Persistent and tenacious Narynbek was able to develop his business to include 10 cows, 7 horses and 5 goats today.  In order to further expand his business, Narynbek went to the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to request a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two horses.  He will invest part of the income into a purchase of a house, thus helping his daughter to buy her own place.  In the future, Narynbek plans to further increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase two horses

loans.name: 03.7.01 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoá Group

texts.en:
Huyền works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in future.

Huyền is 25 years old, married and has one child. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 01 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoá city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

This is Huyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Huyền has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huyền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in future

loans.name: Tatiana Yiselth

texts.es: La joven Tatiana, es una pequeña agricultora de la zona Ticuantepe con muchas ganas de superarse ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su abuelo para ver el cultivo mientras estudia y termina su carrera , Tatiana desde hace tres años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuanta con el recurso económico para darle mantenimiento al cultivo ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para que se desarrolle la fruta y no invadan las plagas ;  que si esto llegara a suceder seria una pérdida total . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para poder salir adelante con la producción de piña .
texts.en:
The young woman Tatiana has a small farm in the Ticuantepe region, and has a lot of eagerness to succeed.  She has the support of her grandfather who keeps an eye on the crops while she is studying and completing her degree.

Tatiana has been working for three years growing pineapples.  Her biggest challenge is that she doesn't have the financial resources to maintain her crops.  She lacks the fertilizers and supplies necessary to grow her fruit and avoid infestations; if this were to happen, it would be a total loss.

She is grateful for the confidence that Afodenic is showing to her through Kiva, so that she can move forward with her pineapple production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Rosalinda has a shop that sells spices, food seasonings and vegetables, such as eggplants and string beans. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings, and vegetables.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 24 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She has been selling used clothes for the last four years, with a monthly profit of KES 6,000.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her third loan of KES 65,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy additional stock of used clothes to sell.  She will save the anticipated profits from this loan and pay her children’s school fees. In the future she hopes to grow her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Mercedes

texts.es:
B. tiene 50 años, vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus 3 hijos en Paiján.  Paiján está ubicada a 2 horas y media  de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque  y es una zona netamente agrícola.

B. se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en el  domicilio de su madre. Allí ofrece a los vecinos de su barrio diversos productos de uso diario. Su negocio cuenta con grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren su negocio debido a la calidad de productos que ofrece y al buen trato con el que los atiende. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad se encarga de ayudar a su conviviente con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

B. desea expandir su negocio ampliando su inventario, especialmente por la campaña navideña, de modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

B. es una mujer bastante tranquila y trabajadora. Sus ganas de salir adelante hacen que siempre se esfuerce por mantener su negocio. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
B. is 50 years old.  She lives in her own home in Paiján with her life-partner and their three children.  Paiján is located two and a half hours away from Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Department of Lambayeque, and is a predominantly agricultural area.

B. works selling everyday products and groceries from a general store in her mother's home.  She has a variety of everyday products that she offers for sale to her neighbors from the area.  Her business has a group of loyal customers who prefer her business thanks to the quality of the products that she sells and to the good service that she provides.  With the income she earns from this activity, she is responsible for helping her partner with the financial upkeep of their family.

B. wants to expand her business by increasing her inventory, especially for the Christmas season, so she can meet the increasing demand from her customers.  This is why she has seen fit to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 new soles.

B. is a very calm and hard-working woman.  Her desire to move ahead in life means that she is always striving to keep her business going.  People who know her consider her to be honorable and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise so as to strengthen her store for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris nació en la  ciudad del Cusco y vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Doris tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos (Aquiles de 20 años, Daniela de 18 años y Alejandro de 5 años). Doris desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.   

Doris se dedica a brindar servicio de hospedaje en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Doris pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Las reuniones de la socias son cada treinta días en la ciudad  de Ollantaytambo. Doris requiere el préstamo para implementar el hospedaje ósea va comprar toallas, jaboncillos y otras cosas más. El sueño de Doris es construir departamento para poder alquilar a turistas.  

Doris se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Doris was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the city of Ollantaytambo. She is 42 years old, and is in a common-law marriage from which she has three children (Aquiles, aged 20, Daniela, aged 18, and Alejandro, aged 5).  Doris undertakes her daily activities and her business activities in the city of Ollantaytambo.   

Doris works providing lodging services in the city of Ollantaytambo.   She has been doing this for 15 years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the determination she brings to her work.

Doris belongs to the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” communal bank, which is part of Asociación  Arariwa and is in the city of Ollantaytambo.  The meetings of the members take place every month in the city of Ollantaytambo. 

Doris is requesting the loan for lodging fundamentals.  She will purchasing towels, soaps, and other additional items.  Doris' dream is to build a space she can rent out to tourists.

Doris is grateful for the opportunity that's being provided through this means, and she also agrees to comply with her corresponding repayment schedule.

loans.use: to supply lodging fundamentals.  She will buy towels, soaps, and other additional items.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 32 years old and single. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years. She has been able to boost her business through financial support from Faulu Kenya. She has also improved her business through her hard work.

Rosemary hopes to expand her business for more income generation. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: El Sr. Celestino, es una persona emprendedora a  la  cual  le  gusta el comercio, es por  ello  que  tiene una tienda de abarrotes que poco a poco a crecido notablemente y debido a la demanda de sus clientes a optado por construir  un  cuarto  mas  grande  en el  cual  continuara  con su  negocio, es por  ello  que requiere  de nuestra  ayuda para  realizar su proyecto,ve  en el  crédito la posibilidad  de  ofrecer a sus  clientes  mayor  comodidad  cuando  lo  visitan  así  como  también le  permitirá  generar mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Celestino is a very motivated person who likes business, and because of this, he has a general store that has been growing little by little. Due to the high demand from his clients, Celestino has decided to build a larger room in which he can continue his business. He needs our help to finish the project, and he sees in credit the possibility to offer his clients a more comfortable and convenient experience when they visit him, and in this way, it will allow him to generate more income.

loans.use: to build a larger space for his business.

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en:
Zephanous is a 42-year-old hardworking man with two children who lives in Kasese Uganda. For the past seven years, he has been operating a clothing shop. He started with 400,000 UGX in working capital and now has over 1,500,000 UGX. Zephanous's business hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. 

Zephanous is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business vision is to expand his business into new areas.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en:
Adowa  is married and has a child.  She  produces locally-made soap called "alata semina" for sale and she also sells sweet potatoes at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a pensioner.  

Adowa uses her income to help her husband in supporting the family. She will use the loan to produce  more soap  and to buy sweet potatoes for sale. With the new profits, Adowa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to produce  more soap  and to buy sweet potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mangalleima Women Group

texts.en:
“I am a weaver and this is the best I can do for a living to assist my husband financially in generating income for the family,” says Rojita, who is one of the members of Mangalleima Women SHG. She is pictured with her hand raised and is also the featured borrower for the group. 

Rojita's husband is a construction labourer and his source of income is unreliable and irregular. Work availability is the factor on which Rojita’s husband's income depends. She joined the Mangalleima Women's group to support herself with her weaving business and also to support other group members in need. All group members live in the same area which is about 40 kms away from the capital town of Manipur, and which is also one of the northeastern states in India.

Rojita weaves women's traditional wrap-around skirts using a loom. She usually gets the weaving materials like yarn and thread from the main market and weaves them. The finished woven products sell well during wedding seasons, as they are one of the main items a woman usually takes along to her in-laws house. The generated income is not sufficient to purchase weaving yarn and thread in abundance as she also shares the family's financial burden. 

To meet the demand of her customers, Rojita will purchase good quality yarn and thread with her Kiva loan and weave them. With the income she will open an account and start saving. She also says she will regularly repay the loan amount on time. She wishes to purchase a two-wheeler scooter for her husband so that he won’t be late for work and can efficiently perform his duty. She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the help and wishes to continue working under their sponsorship. She says, “Thank you, Kiva!”

The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving, poultry, piggery and rice-selling businesses.

loans.use: To purchase good quality yarn and thread for weaving

loans.name: Ansarul Isl Pri Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers. They work at one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers of this school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, for a loan of SLL 18,600,000 in order to improve their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children, and so on. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible to deduct their repayment amounts from their salaries, and to pay SMT.

Abdul is the featured leader of this group of teachers. The 50-year-old Abdul was born in Tongo-Fields, Eastern Sierra Leone. He is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 32 years. Abdul is married to a housewife, and they have four children who are attending school or college. Abdul has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials for the construction of a dwelling, including corrugated iron sheets, sand, cement, and iron rods.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials, including corrugated iron sheets, sand, cement, and iron rods.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a 28-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small agricultural center near Mount Kenya. She owns a small piece of land together with her husband, and they have been blessed with one child. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle,goat and grown maize for five years. 

From Kiva lenders, Jenifer is seeking a loan worth KES 10,000 to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Juhudi has teamed up with KIVA to offer Jenifer access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business.
She counts on help from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders. 

Help this mother and wife make her dreams a reality so that she can provide a great life to her family. Donate now.
Make a change this December festive season by granting this woman a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 53 years old. He is married and they are blessed with 3 children. He has a restaurant has been in the business for 11 years. 

This is his 7th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy cooking fat, wheat and maize flour, beans, rice, milk ,tea leaves and sugar for use in his restaurant and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

He will use the profits from expanded business to improve the living standard of his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, wheat and maize flour, beans, rice, milk ,tea leaves and sugar and be able to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy seedlings for planting on her land.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab D/O S. H. lives in District 5 of Kabul City. She is married and has five Children. During the wars in Afghanistan, she immigrated to Pakistan. In Pakistan she was living in a very difficult condition so she returned to Afghanistan. Her family suffered financially, because her husband was jobless for a year and her children weren't able to go to school.  Her husband found a job, but the family needed further support, so she started a tailoring business in her home. Zainab requests a loan of $175 to buy an electric sewing machine and fabrics which will enable her to make fine clothes more quickly and earn more income. She is understands the loan process and is happy to have an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine, fabrics and thread

loans.name: Khumar

texts.en: Khumar F. is married and has four children. Her profit comes from selling women’s clothes in the center bazaar. In 2000 Mrs. F. borrowed a $1200 USD loan to increase her business, and she plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to make her business even more successful.

loans.use: Mrs. Farzaliyeva would like to broaden her store's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue buying merchandise and making aesthetic improvements to her bakery

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Phally has been married since 1987 and has 4 children - 2 sons and 2 daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1984, and started her silk-weaving business that same year. Her eldest daughter currently works in the make-up business.  

Mrs. T. has borrowed from MAXIMA already three times. This time she is requesting a loan of US$500 which will be used to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk for looms.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk for looms

loans.name: David Fernando

texts.pt:
David Fernando E. was born in Maputo on the 10th of October 1978. His is 29 years old and studied through the 9th grade. He supports 5 people (even though he lives with just 3) and is married. He grew up and lived the majority of his life with his mother and siblings. While he was a student in his free time he took classes in tailoring and practiced karate. For the last 10 years he has been working as a tailor; sewing and doing emboidery. He also gives sewing classes and is a sewing machine repair technician. He employs three people, one with 5 children, another with 2 and the last with one. With the loan for 12,000MT he plans to purchase fabric, thread and dyes. He runs the business out of his home which enables him to open the shop at 8:00 and work for 16 hours. His employees come using public transportation, some travling a great distance. The raw materials are purchased in Maputo or in South Africa, and transported on public busses. Summer is his high season since his customers re-sell his goods in open air markets or on the beaches where domestic and foreign tourists can shop and buy his products. The average weekly income is 3,000MT - and he has a system to record the purchase of raw materials, good produced and goods sold. His business is currently doing well and provides a monthly return of 10,000MT which he uses to care for his family, pay his employees' salaries, do some home repairs and even save a little. For the future he plans to expand his business and to purchase additional sewing machines - to do this he will have to take out an additional loan to guarantee the success of this expansion. His customers are very satisfied with his work and his main objective is to increase the volume of orders and hire additional employees to meet the growing demand.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

David Fernando E. nasceu na Cidade de Maputo aos 10 de Outubro de 1978, tem 29 anos de idade, concluiu a 9ªclasse, sustenta 5 pessoas e vive com apenas 3 e é casado maritalmente. Cresceu e viveu grande parte da vida com a mãe e seus irmãos , estudava e nos tempos livres ia ao curso de corte e costura e também practicava karate. Actualmente faz trabalhos de corte e costura, estampagem, batique e dá aulas de corte e costura a sensivelmente 10 anos e segundo este frequentou curso de corte de costura e também é técnico de reparação de máquinas de costura, emprega actaualmente 3 empregados dos quais 1 tem 5,2 e 1 filhos respectivamente. Com o crédito de 12.000MT pretende comprar tecidos, linhas e tintas. O empreendimento está localizado em sua residência facto que lhe facilita e portanto abre as 8:00 e fecha 16 horas e os trablhadores para chegarem ao local tem que apanhar transporte colectivo e as vezes percorrem grandes distancias. A matéria prima é adquirida em Maputo e na Àfrica do Sul e usa o transporte colectivo para levar os materiais e o verão é o período com mais clientes porque geralmente expõem e vendem ao ar livre na praia onde turistas nacionais e estrangeiros apreciam e compram. A receita média semanal é de 3.000MT e o que dá mais lucro é o Batique e tem um sistema montado de registo de materiais primas, produtos produzidos e vendidos. O grande constragimento que tem emfrentado é a falta de clientes, contudo de alguma maneira não afecta o pagamento das letras. O estágio actual do empreendiemnto é saudável e tem uma margem do lucro mensal de 10.000MT e estes rendimentos usa-os para sustento familiar, pagar salários, construir sua residência e se possível poupar. No futuro a perspectiva é expandir a actividade e comprar mais máquinas de costura e terá que recorrer ao crédito para como garante para o sucesso d sua actividade. O cliente está bastante satisfeito com emprendimento e a maior conquista é aumentar o volume de encomendas e ter nais trabalhadores para responder com prontidão a demanda.

loans.use: To buy row material to make clothes

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
When she started her small business two years ago, Felipa was just selling sandwiches and juices. Shortly after, she decided to run a grocery store because “people of the community really needed such a thing” she explains. Felipa kept fighting to make her business successful, and one year later she obtained an FSMA loan, which helped her assure the subsistence of her store. Felipa has three children who range in age from 13 to 17.

Felipa envisions her grocery store becoming the biggest of her community. She thinks that December is a suitable month to increase her sales volume and her income. She has requested a loan to buy more goods with which to replenish her store. Felipa is putting money aside to support her eldest son's university studies next year.

loans.use: To replenish a grocery store to keep on satisfying the customers needs.

loans.name: Sylvanus

texts.fr:
Mr. Sylvanus E. is 32 years old and a married father of three children, two of whom currently attend school. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last three years. The income he earns allows him to pay for his children’s education. To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, he would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to send his children to school and to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Sylvanus E. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 03 enfants dont 02 sont sur les bancs de l’école. Il est propriétaire d'une boutique de vente des pièces détachées des engins à deux roue, activité qu'il exerce depuis 03 ans et les revenus de son activité lui permettent de financer les charges scolaires de ses enfants. Pour répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de la clientèle, il souhaite augmenter la capacité de sa boutique. Les bénéfices issus de ces ventes lui permettront de supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie

loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare moped engine parts

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola R. is 44 years old, married with 4 children and comes from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells kerosene. She has been in business since 2002. She requests a loan in the amount of $700 to buy more kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sale

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
I have lived all of my life in a small city called Chichawatni in Pakistan. I am a widow and a mother of two kids. I raise goats to supplement my work as a day laborer. When these goats reach a reasonable age I sell them at a decent price. I want to buy a few additional goats for my business.

There are four other women in my loan group: Nazira B., who is borrowing for her grocery store; Walan B., who will invest her share of the loan to buy a machine for their business; Manzoora B., who embroiders clothes; and Parween A., who wants to buy a donkey cart. These women are very cooperative and will repay your loan on time in a responsible manner.

loans.use: Buy a few goats

loans.name: Veronica's Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years old and is married with two children. Her children are 15 and 10 years old. Veronica sells food in her local market. She started her business in 2002. She works from 6am to 7pm each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Veronica has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Jamila, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items (rice, flour, maize, beans, peas) for her business

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah Q.  is a manufacturer of a local gin (drink). He is married and has four children. His business is doing very well and he would like to use this loan to purchase more raw materials to increase production and thus, sales of the gin. This will improve his standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for production of a local drink.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom C. is a villager in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She sells clothing and would like to request a loan to buy more fashionable clothes for her customers in order to expand her business. She will combine the rest of the money with her business profits and buy cow for breeding.

Mrs. Rom C. is a widow with two children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy more fashionable clothes to sell and to buy cow for breeding.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is a very hard-working woman who chose to work in sales since she considers herself a very good saleswoman, which she has proved as her business has improved over time.

Gladys sells baked goods like breads and cookies. She began offering her products to her friends and neighbors, but now she has a large list of customers, many of whom make large orders. In order to accommodate the large orders, Gladys uses a moto-car (a small enclosed, motorcycle-like vehicle) to deliver her products; this vehicle has become a key part of her business.

Gladys is seeking a loan in order to repair her moto-car which currently has various mechanical problems; without the moto-car, Gladys cannot deliver her products rapidly to her customers. With a thankful heart, Gladys hopes to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys es una mujer trabajadora, eligió dedicarse a las ventas, porque considera que es muy buena vendedora, y el paso del tiempo y la mejora de su negocio lo han demostrado. Lo que Gladys vende son productos de repostería, como panes y galletas. Ella se inició ofreciendo a sus vecinos y amigos, pero ahora tiene una gran lista de clientes, que el hacen grandes pedidos, por lo cual Gladys decidió utilizar un motocarro para el reparto de sus productos, este vehículo se ha convertido en pieza clave para su negocio, y es el motivo del pedido que hace ahora, solicita un préstamo para repararte dicho motocarro, que tiene desperfectos mecánicos, y sin él, Gladys no puede repartir con rapidez sus productos. Con el corazón agradecido, Gladys espera que le brinden el préstamo.

loans.use: Repair her moto-car which she used to deliver the merchandise she sells

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng H., age 36, is a former farmer and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling a particular type of mint to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$5 of profit a day. This kind of mint is the type they normally put in fried rice and soups to make the food smell good. Her husband, Sun Saridh, age 43, runs a business catching fish and selling it to the market to earn an approximately US$5 of profit per day. This couple has five children together, three of whom are employed and the other two are students. She told a loan officer that she needs to pay around US$85 for food and about US$15 on her children's education. 

Mrs. Seng is seeking a loan of US$1,200 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase a wooden boat with a motor and fishing tools in order to catch more fish.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat with a motor and fishing tools in order to catch more fish.

loans.name: Gurez

texts.ru: Гадоев Гурез житель района Вахш . Возраст 46 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того занимается сельским хозяйством. Выращивает семечки. Полученный урожай продает оптом. В данный момент урожай поспел и для сбора и реализации необходима транспортировка. Для этого и планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ему своевременно реализовать товар и подготовить землю к новому посеву.
texts.en:
Gurez G. is a resident of the Vakhsh region. 46-years-old, he is married and has four children. He teaches in a high school, and additionally engages in agriculture, growing sunflower seeds. The resulting crop is sold wholesale. His crop is now ripe and the 12-month loan he plans to take out would go towards harvesting and shipping it. This will help him to sell his goods on time and to prepare the ground for a new planting.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Transporting his harvest

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura inició el negocio porqué le gusta tener su propio dinero, ser una persona independiente y poder comprarme sus cosas y además ayudar a su mamá con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó en septiembre de 2004 vendiendo en una mesita al frente de su casa con la ayuda de su mamá, fue entonces que le empezó a ir bien y se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar un carrito para elaborar tortas, lo cual le ayudó a tener mas espacio y a vender mas. Como esta actividad es solo por las noches, en el día aprovecha para dedicarse a vender ropa entre sus amistades, vecinos y familiares, y también le ha ido muy bien. El anterior crédito con KIVA lo ocupó para invertirlo en materia prima para la elaboración de comida pero este que esta solicitando lo invertirá parte en materiales y parte en la compra de ropa para vender.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para adquirir materia prima que le permita elaborar mas cenas tales como sopes, tostadas, gorditas, tortas, etc. y para compra de ropa de temporada para dama con lo cual piensa incrementar sus ganancias
texts.en:
Rosura started her business because she likes to have her own money, be an independent person, and be able to buy things for herself and help her mother with household expenses. She started in September of 2004, selling food on a table in front of her house, with help from her mother. The business was doing well so when an opportunity to buy a small cart presented itself, and she bought the cart to have more space to sell cakes. Because Rosura only sells meals at night, Rosura spends her days selling clothing to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. This business has also taken off. Rosura's previous loan with Kiva was invested in raw materials to make food, but Rosura will invest this new loan partially in materials and partially in clothing to sell. Rosura needs a loan of US$400, which she will repay in 5 months. She'll use the money to buy raw materials to make more dishes like soups, tostadas, gorditas, cakes, etc. and to buy women's clothing for the season, which she thinks will increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: San

texts.en: San T. is 32 years old and the mother of five children. San is a villager in Lvea Sor Kandal Village in the Kandal Province. She is farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Ning Sareth, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support his family (he is presented on the right of the photo). She faces a problem on her plantation because her field is infertile which affects her crops. She is asking for a loan to buy more fertilizer to help make her crops more productive.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Dim

texts.en: Mr. Dim P. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chan Yan, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They earn less income than they need to support their household. Thus, Mr. Dim P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to reduce his expense for plowing. He hopes to increase income and provide a better life for his family. He is 50 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Eit

texts.en: Mrs. Eit S. is a villager in Takol village in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns one hectare to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Prak Phan, helps her on the plantation. Although they try to work hard, they still earn little revenue from the rice to support the family. Also, they live in an old house. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Eit S. decided to ask for a loan to use with her savings to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Eit S. is 55 years old and the mother of three children who are all working as construction workers.

loans.use: To help build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is a 29-year-old entrepreneur who sells second-hand clothes at Nyamasaria market, Kisumu, Kenya. She began this business with her late husband in 1999. She gets her products from Kibuye Market, Kisumu, Kenya from wholesalers on a fortnightly basis. She deals  mostly in women's dresses since they sell faster and thus she is able to make around Kshs 2,000-3,000 in profit a week. Her business is able to generate enough profit to help her meet her household expenses and pay school fees for her three children. She has applied for a loan in the amount of US $ 275 to purchase more merchandise for sale.

loans.use: Purchase additional stocks of used clothing

loans.name: Gutu

texts.en: This is Gutu M. she lives in Stefan Voda district and she is willing to start her own business, namely in grain and vegetable growing. She wishes to launch this business because she has the possibility to buy new clothes with a very low price so she can earn very good profit in the future. She is 59 years old but she is a mother of two children that are pupils in the middle school in Copceac village. She decided to borrow a loan from MicroInvest to start her business namely to increase working capital for agriculture. Her future plan is to build a green house in her garden to have a rich harvest all year around.

loans.use: increases working capital

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Valentín Abecia de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz , es estudiante de la escuela Hotelera en el área de Gastronomía; el crédito que solicita es para pagar sus estudios y continuar estudiando, trabaja por las noches en una Discoteca de garzón con cuyos ingresos se mantiene y puede solventar sus estudios.

No es cliente de Impro, pero por la actividad y el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Luis lives at home with his parents on Valentin Abecia Street in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. He is studying food services at a hotel school, Escuela Hotelera. The loan he is requesting is to pay for his studies and to continue studying. He works at night as a waiter in a disco using the income to support himself and to complete his studies.

He is not client of Impro, but he meets the requirements to qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay tuition to continue studying food services at the hotel school in La Paz

loans.name: María Mercedees

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora María Mercedes Q. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de ropa la cual atiende en su establecimiento teniendo sus vitrinas y un lugar muy bien acondicionado que ha logrado suplir gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Es de importancia destacar que ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y hoy en día la razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la ropa y de esta forma continuar mejorando su negocio en su local.
texts.en:
In the city of Leon, Maria Mercedes Q. works hard operating a business selling clothing. She operates the business from a shop with display cases, a space that's been well fitted out thanks to her efforts. It's important to note that she stands out as an especially hard-working woman. She's approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan so that she can buy clothing and, in that way, continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Consolata Juma

texts.en: Consolata Juma O. is a 40-year-old mother of seven children. She lives with her husband in Nymasaria slum where he sells goat, cow, and sheep skin while she runs a small hotel/restaurant. She sells beans, chapati, porridge, and mandazi. She says right now there are fewer customers than normal. She is asking for a loan to buy oil, sugar, and baking powder in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: Food for Restaurant

loans.name: Afusa

texts.en:
K. Afusa is a businesswoman, aged 38. She has a retail shop located in Buwega Kampala, which she has run for over seven years.

She is using the loan to purchase more items for the shop, such as soap, paraffin, sugar, salt, sweets, cakes, and sodas.

K. Afusa is a widow with three children in school. Her future plan is to build rental houses to generate extra income.

loans.use: To purchase more items for the shop such as soap, paraffin, sugar, salt, sweets, cakes, and sodas.

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Cristina L. actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de cosméticos y productos personales ofrecidos en su propio tramo en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

Ella hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito por la razón de que en Nicaragua pronto será el día de las Madres y requiere comprar más cosméticos y productos personales como carteras para ofertarlas y así tener una venta exitosa y mejorar su condición en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Cristina L. currently has a business in personal products and cosmetic sales from her own stall in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua.

Today, she has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan because in Nicaragua it will soon be Mother’s Day, and she needs to buy more cosmetics and personal products such as wallets that she can offer. In this way she can have successful sales and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and personal products

loans.name: Enisa

texts.en:
Enisa K. was born in 1968 and comes from the suburbs of Tuzla. She has two children: her son is 19  and daughter is 15. Enisa`s husband works as a driver for a gasoline company.

Enisa is employed as a seller in a local grocery store. Besides that, she grows vegetables in her garden and breeds chickens. She is one of our longer-term clients: she has already repaid two loans which were invested in her poultry business.

Enisa requested her third loan from WWI (Žene za Žene International) in the amount of 1,000 KM to purchase chickens and poultry feed. Enisa sells chicken meat through the store where she works and also to her repeat clients. In this way she provides more household income for her family and thus an easier life.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and poultry feed

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans N. T. is a fisherman in Torkor at Kpando. Evans N. has received a junior high education.  He is married and has 10 dependants. His wife is a fishmonger who depends on her husband's catch. He is solely responsible for all his personal needs and that of the 10 dependants. He will use his loan to buy fishing accessories, to replace his old and outmoded boat, and to replace his fishing net. He hopes to reinvest the new profit from his business.

loans.use: To buy fishing accessories

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is 42 years old and married with four children. She sells crates of drinks. She started selling drinks seven years ago and her business is growing. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: aminata N. est une societaire de la caisse de bayelaye qui est tres experimentee dans le domainede l'aviculture.elle sollicite un credit cinq cent mille (500 000)en vue d'augmenter ses sujets.l'amelioration de ses revenus lui permettra de mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges familliales.
texts.en:
Aminata N. is a member of the bank of Bayelaye who is very experienced in the domain of poultry farming. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs with the aim of increasing what she has. Increasing her revenues will allow her to support her husband with managing family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Michael Ndungu

texts.en: Michael M. is 57 years old and is married to Elizabeth Jambi who is 45 years old. They have three children, namely Rachel, Ken and Manase. Michael's primary business is his garage and he has managed the business for the last six years. Michael was introduced to KADET through other clients and he had not received a loan from another micro-loan organization before. With the loan he has applied for he intends to buy more motor-vehicle spare-parts for resale to his clients. Michael believes he is hardworking and in future he aspires to own a bigger garage. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy motor-vehicle spare-parts for sale to his clients

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es:
La señora Gissela A. tiene 35 años D. edad, con 3 hijos, casada, su domicilio se ubica en santa clara, distrito D.  Ate,  departamento D.  Lima. Actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “los Capullitos”.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  hace 1 año y 5 meses, su alcancía comunal esta conformada por 11 socios los cuales realizan diversas actividades como venta D. salchipapa, venta D. ropa, venta D. zapatos usados, servicio D. mototaxi, arreglos y confecciones, limpieza D. hogar y otros. 
Gissela se dedica  a la venta D. ropa según pedidos desD. hace un año, comenzó vendiendo comida en un mercado y como no le generaba muchos ingresos, decidió cambiar D. rubro y optó por la venta D. ropa a domicilio que hasta el momento le va muy  bien, gracias a sus esfuerzos y su trabajo  logro comprarse un mototaxi y arreglar su casa. Su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D.  ropas D. diversos modelos para cubrir los pedidos solicitados y en realizar mantenimiento D. su mototaxi.
 
En el futuro anhela  comprase un auto  para ponerlo a  trabajar como taxi y poder así generar mas  ingresos para su hogar
texts.en:
Mrs Gissela A., 35, is married with 3 children and lives in Santa Clara, in the district of Ate, department of Lima. She currently occupies the role of president of the communal bank "Los Capullitos" and has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for 1 year and 5 months. Her communal bank is maD. up of 11 partners who work in different activities, such as the sale of sausages and fried potatoes, the sale of clothes, the sale of used shoes, mototaxi services, repairs and dress-making, cleaning houses and others.

Gissela has been working in the sale of clothes to order for one year. She started selling food in a market, which didn't generate much income, so she decided to change direction and chose to sell clothes at home which has worked very well. Thanks to her efforts and work, she has been able to buy a mototaxi and repair her house. She will use the new loan to buy different types of clothes to meet her orders and to maintain her mototaxi. In the future, she would like to buy a car to use as a taxi to be able to generate more income for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For investment in the purchase of different types of clothing to meet orders and the maintenance of her mototaxi.

loans.name: Lucía Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, la señora Lucía del Carmen S. dedica sus esfuerzos a su actividad de pulpería donde a diario ofrece los productos para lograr mejorar su condición económica.

Actualmente, la señora Lucía solicitó un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y por este motivo es que ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera proceder a la compra de los productos tales como comestibles y bebidas para la pulpería.

loans.use: Compra de los productos

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Ella tiene una carpintería donde realiza todo tipo de muebles y mangos para herramientas de trabajo para los agricultores, como los picos y las palas. Hubo una época en que  la venta de estos mangos decreció y esa fue la oportunidad para que empezara con el diseño y fabricación de muebles económicos y a la vez durables, los cuales son muy demandados por sus clientes, quienes son especialmente los comerciantes de muebles de su localidad y de la ciudad capital, Lima.
