Para el futuro, Elena desea crecer más en su negocio e implementar su taller con mejores equipos e instrumentos.
Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona que promueve la unidad en su banco comunal y por su buen carácter es muy apreciada en su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará en la implementación de su taller, instalando electricidad industrial, es decir la trifásica.
texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old, and lives with her husband in her own house. She has a carpenter’s workshop where she builds all types of furniture and handles for agricultural work tools, such as picks and shovels. There was a time when the sale of these handles declined, and she took this opportunity to begin designing and building inexpensive furniture that was also durable; this furniture is now in high demand by her clients, who are the furniture merchants of her locality in the capital city of Lima. In the future, Elena would like for her business to continue growing, and to set up a workshop with better tools and equipment.

This is the second opportunity she has had to get a loan through MFP; she is a person that promotes unity in her Communal Bank and because of her good character she is highly valued by her group. The money that she is requesting will be used to work on her workshop by installing industrial electricity, that is to say, three-phased electric power.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing electricity in her carpenter’s workshop.

loans.name: Olajumoke

texts.en: Olajumoke has a salon and she also sells clothes at various prices. She is 30 years old and married with two children. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the requirements of her clients. At the time of taking this photo, she was about to go to the market to purchase more goods because all of her goods were sold. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more clothes and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es: En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ruth R. se esfuerza grandemente para llevar el sustento de su hogar. Se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Actualmente ella solicita un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de medicamentos para su mamá debido a que está enferma y requiere de su apoyo para proporcionarle dichos medicamento. Es por este motivo que ella espera confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Ruth R. works hard to bring money home. She is known for being an assiduous person with big wishes to improve. Currently she requests a loan to invest it directly in the purchase of medicine for her mother, because she is sick and needs her support to provide medicine. It’s because of this that she waits while her loan is successfully approved.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine for her mother

loans.name: Pea

texts.en:
Pea E. is a 65-year-old woman living in the town of Vaisala.  She is married and has 6 school-aged children.  To make a living, Pea owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Pea has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 150 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Pea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Pea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to repair borrower's fishing boat.  Pea is now requesting a new loan of 1450 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Pea plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio B. is from the city of Linao Norte Tuguegarao. He is 47 years old. Antonio is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio works in a family member's business venture in the services sector, providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta T. is from the village of Capellan,Ilagan,Isabela. She is 52 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children.

Aniceta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. With her vending business, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Aniceta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI.

Aniceta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Petit Kandé depuis 7 ans et demi et y a reçu 15 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait le commerce de bouillie de mil, elle achète le produit en vrac, le transforme et le prépare en repas pour le petit déjeuné et le soir. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Coumba Diamnka is a 47 year-old married mother of three. She has been a member of Petit Kandé's Banc Villageois for 7 and a half years, and has received 15 loans, all of which have been well managed and repaid. She makes bouillie (a hot breakfast cereal made from millet) for a living; she buys the product in bulk, processes it, and manufactures it into a breakfast or evening meal. She is actively involved in day-to-day family duties.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her commercial productivity

loans.name: Maria Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ROSMERY A. A., es una productora de leche, trabaja en su granja de vacas que son 14, tiene buena producción.Trabaja en la misma hacen 20 años, habiendo crecido bastante.  Es casada, el esposo trabaja la tierra en Santa Cruz, otro departamento.  Ella tiene 4 hijos, tiene 39 años.La tierra es herencia de los padres. 

El crédito està destinado para la compra de soya, que en esta época escasea.  Quiere crecer un poco màs para mejorar sus condiciones de vida que todavía no son de comodidad.
texts.en:
MARIA ROSMERY A. A., 39, is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farm laborer in Santa Cruz, which is a different department. She inherited her land, on which she has a dairy farm composed of 14 cows, from her parents; production is good. She has had it for 20 years and it has grown considerably. She will use the funds to buy soy, which is scarse this time of year. She would like her business to grow a bit more so that she can improve her living conditions, which aren't yet as comfortable as she'd like them to be.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala P. is 24 years old and single. She is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and bread, and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Kamala hopes to be able to go back to school for more studies.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina C. is from barangay La Victoria, Aurora Municipality, Zamboanga Del Sur Province. She is 41 years old. Agustina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Agustina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling Tupperware or plastic products like lunch boxes, food containers, etc. in the local community. Agustina is just starting this business.

In 2008, Agustina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agustina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Agustina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.es:
Emerenciana es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Emerenciana es casada, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Emerenciana tiene carros con los cuales realizan transporte interprovincial, su esposo e hijos son los encargados D. conducir los carros.
Emerenciana necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. neumáticos.
El sueño D. Emerenciana es comprar mas carros.
texts.en:
Emerenciana is a member of the Bienestar [Wellbeing] Communal Bank. She is 48 years old and is married with three children. Emerenciana has cars with which she operates an inter-provincial transport service. Her husband and sons are the drivers for the service. Emerenciana needs a loan of 3000 soles in order to buy tires for her cars. Her dream is to be able to buy more cars.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is the wife of A. R. and they both live in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. They have been there for the past 35 years. They both are very hard working people. They manage their grocery shop, which is situated in the community. People come to their shop for purchasing groceries. They both help each other by dividing their time. Suraiya minds the shop in the morning and her husband minds the shop in the evening. Their income helps them to improve their standard of living.

Suraiya is requesting of a loan to purchase items, including cooking oil, rice and beverages to diversify their grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase goods for grocery shop.

loans.name: Women Of Success Group

texts.en: Comfort G. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Women Of Success Group. She is 27 years old, is married, and has a 4-year-old child. She also cares for a few relatives. She is presently a college student but is also involved in business. In the photo, she is the one holding the sign. For four years Comfort has been selling oil at the Omega Tower Community in Paynesville, Liberia. She gives her customers good service which makes them keep returning. Comfort started selling with a small amount of funds borrowed from her savings club. She faces problems with having inadequate capital for her business which gives her a small problem. Comfort plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more goods to sell. Her goal is to expand her business for the benefit of her family. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María de 31 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, su esposo es obrero ellos tiene un hijo de 6 meses. 

Ella empezó con el negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares de su casa y para que su esposo tenga mas oportunidad de pasar tiempo con ellos, reubico su casa para poner un local en la parte delantera y compro víveres para el hogar. En la actualidad ella tiene una tienda muy surtida, trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener tiendas de víveres para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years-old, and lives in the Guasmo urban zone in Guayaquil with her husband (a day-worker) and 6-month old son. She started her business in order to help cover family expenses and to allow her husband to spend more time at home. She re-arranged her house so she could open a food/provisions store-front. Her store is well-stocked and offers a wide variety of products, and she works every day from 6:30am to 11:00pm. With this loan, she plans to buy notebooks and display cabinets for her business. In the future, she wants to own several similar stores so she can continue to ensure her family's financial future.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and display cabinets for her business

loans.name: Lipsia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Lipsia Del Carmen es casada, tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su vivienda ella nos dice que  es muy gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio. Con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación. Con el trabajo y el buen manejo de su negocio hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso. Y con este financiamiento planea comprar productos como golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes, pan y galletas. Su deseo es tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Lipsia Del Carmen is married and she runs a small general store in her house. She told us it is very satisfactory and that she can already count on a considerable number of customers, and that the earnings are quite satisfactory as well. Thanks to her husband's help they are getting by through their will, hard work and dedication. Thanks to her work and good management of her business she has now transformed her activity into a successful small business that is continuously growing. With the loan she is requesting she plans to buy products such as sweets, basic grains, bread and biscuits. She wishes to have a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials (wood, nails, and zinc) to repair his roof

loans.name: Nardito

texts.en: Nardito S. is from the village of Wilcom, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 55 years old. Nardito is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Nardito operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice in the local community. Nardito has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Nardito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nardito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nardito is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Nardito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. Rebecca also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall where she sells second-hand clothing and shoes in Owino market, which is one of the busiest markets in Uganda. Rebecca wants to use this loan to buy more bales of men’s clothing. She has no other source of additional income. 

Rebecca has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. One of her biggest business challenges is the rainy season because she works from an open place. Rebecca aspires to see her business grow big and to start importing clothes herself.  She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting additional capital.  

She resides in a  rented two-room house which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest expenses are school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of men's clothing

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes O. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 59 years old, widowed, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Mercedes owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste from a direct-selling company in the local community. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Mercedes joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Juana Lidia

texts.es:
Juana de 43 años, ella tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”). Vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín” y caracterizada por su pobreza y sus caminos de tierra.  

Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Para incrementar sus ingresos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos y dulces ya que la mayoría de clientes son niños. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa, y con los ingresos poder ayuda a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana, 43, has a stationery store (in Ecuador, it is called a "bazar.") She lives in a neighborhood in the outskirts of Guayaquil called "Fortin," which is characterized by its poverty and its dirt roads. Juana started her stationery business so that she could support her family, selling notebooks, pens and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she had enough money she set up a small stationery store in the front of her house. She works from 8am until 8pm every day. To increase her income she wants to use the loan to buy notebooks and sweets, since the majority of her customers are children. In the future she wants to make improvements to her house and be able to help her children with her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy notebooks and sweets

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle L. is from the village of Villaverde, Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Roselle is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Roselle operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling school supplies in the local community. Roselle has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Roselle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselle is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roselle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Julio Alfonso

texts.es:
Julio de 26 años, es vendedor de panes en las calles de Paraíso, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  

Inicio el negocio hace 6 años atrás cuando descubrió la habilidad que tenia para hacer panes, poco a poco comenzó a trabajar para mantener a su familia. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 14h00pm repartiendo pan y después hasta las 21h00pm haciendo panes para el siguiente día.

El quiere comprar con el préstamo víveres como arroz, azúcar, harina para crear una pequeña tienda y asegurar el futuro de su esposa ya que esta embarazada. En el futuro quiere arreglar el local.
texts.en:
Julio is 26 years old and sells bread in the streets of Paraíso. He lives in the semi-urban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil, which is known for its dirt roads and mountains. He started his business six years ago, when he discovered the ability he had for making bread. Little by little, he began to work to sustain his family. Now he works distributing bread from 6:00AM until 2:00PM, and after he works until 9:00PM making bread for the following day. He would like to use this loan to buy food supplies like rice, sugar, and flour, in order to set up a small store and thereby ensure the future for his wife, who is now pregnant. In the future, he would like to fix up the location.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is from the village of Sto.Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 47 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Edna operates a motorcycle transport business. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to repair the vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Edna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her  extended family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Food

loans.name: 29 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El comité “29 de Setiembre” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Limpio.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes  ,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 

La Señora Graciela es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la  venta de productos de limpieza varias para la comunidad.
En fin realiza realiza varias actividades, es un señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unidad con 4  hijos y su marido es empleado.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Graciela solicita el crédito para la ampliacion de su ventas de producto de limpieza.
texts.en:
The "September 29" committee was formed through the union of a group of neighbors in the city of Limpio. All of the committee members have independent work activities, such as sales or fast food preparation. 

The members have formed a group that is very united and able to undertake shared activities that strengthen their sense of teamwork. 

Graciela is one of the members of the committee. Her work is selling assorted cleaning products in her community. In fact, she carries out a range of activities; she is a very creative woman, and her customers admire her very much for her hard work. She has a very united family,  with 4 children and her husband, who is an employee.  

Graciela is very satisfied with her work and with the training that the group receives. She is requesting the loan to expand her sales of cleaning products.

loans.use: Buying cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Edwin Rene

texts.es:
Edwin, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 19, 16, 5 años de edad, el mayor de los hijos estudia en la universidad y trabaja al mismo tiempo, el segundo también estudia bachillerato, y la chiquitina esta en Kínder, el negocio funciona bajo la dinámica de ofrecer almuerzos a domicilio a los empleados que laboran en un edificio contiguo a su casa, donde los empleados piden que la comida les sea llevada hasta su oficina.
Ahora él está solicitando un préstamo porque quiere compra mercadería de cocina (pollo, carne, quesillo) y  equipo para instalar una pupuseria atendiéndola en horas nocturnas de 6:00 a 9:00 pm,  este préstamo ayudara a diversificar sus productos a la venta ya que hasta el momento su fuerte han  sido los almuerzos, las pupusas presentan mucha demanda es por eso la iniciativa de ofrecer una nueva actividad.
Su sueño es establecer un negocio con bases solidas, poder ver a sus hijos realizados y generar cada día mejores ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Edwin sells food, is 35 years old, and lives with his wife and three children, ages 19, 16, and 5.  The eldest of his children attends college and works at the same time, the second child is in high school, and the little one is in kindergarten.  The business operates under the dynamics of providing lunches to employees who work in a building adjacent to his house, where the employees ask for food to be delivered to their office.

Edwin is applying for a loan now because he wants to buy food materials (chicken, beef, cheese) and equipment to intall a pupuseria (restaurant that serves pupusas, meat filled corn tortillas), operating in the evening hours of 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm.  This loan will help to diversify the products that he sells.  So far his strength has been the lunches, but the pupusas are in high demand so that is his initiative of offering a new activity.

His dream is to establish a business with a solid foundation to be able to wtiness his children's achievements and generate more income for the household.

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef, and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, corn

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey sells spare parts for Russian and Ukrainian cars. Since these parts are in high demand, his business is quite successful.  Andrey has been an entrepreneur for 10 years. He has good business qualities such as honesty and respect toward his customers. He always knows what his clients need. His pricing also attracts customers.

Andrey enjoys his business and wants to develop it further. He is requesting a loan of 18,000 Grivnas to purchase more inventory. This will allow him to increase the variety of his offerings and to better serve his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Martha La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, la socia trabaja junto a su conyugue ella le apoya en la zapatería que él tiene en casa y ellos juntos, venden todo artículo relacionado con los zapatos y accesorios como suelas, plantillas de zapatos, pastas para todo tipo de zapatos, escobillas y otros. La socia se encarga de dar los últimos acabados a los zapatos que se hacen o también a los accesorios o a la lustrada de zapatos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de zapatos y también para comprar plantillas y otros.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA” (Urubamba's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Martha is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  Martha works with her partner, supporting him in the shoe-making business that they have located in their home.  Together they sell all sorts of items related to shoes and accessories such as soles, insoles, shoe polish, shoe brushes, etc.  Martha is in charge of giving the finishing touches to the shoes that they make.  She also sells the accessories and shines shoes.

Matha is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making shoes and also to buy insoles etc.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in buying materials for making shoes and also to buy insoles, etc.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa T. is a single parent taking care of four children. She has been through senior high school. Adjoa prepares Fante kenkey (type of dumpling) for sale at Abura. Adjoa uses her income to see to the well-being of her family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more maize to be able to produce in a larger quantity for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to be able to produce kenkey in a larger quantity for sale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea N. is a 39-year-old married man who currently lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang province. He is a motor taxi driver in and around his community, and he can earn an average income of $2 each day for supporting his family. His wife is fish seller. They have three children, all of all whom are single and still live with them. This family has lived in their house for many years, and they have never repaired it. A few parts of their house are very old and broken also. Because of this, Chea N. is seeking funds in order to buy cement, sand, and to hire construction workers to repair his old house.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and to hire the construction workers to repair his old house.

loans.name: Lidia Ingrid

texts.es: La señora Lidia nacida el 5 de abril de 1986 en Jorochito tiene 2 hijos pequeños, ella es primera vez que esta sacando crédito de Emprender  el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y también para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra en la Elvira a 15 km de Jorochito en el lote de su madre y trabaja en tierras alquiladas o anticrético para la siembra de papa y maíz, una ves que cosecha sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de el torno, es una joven Madre con ganas de superación, desea con el tiempo comprarse sus propias tierras, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Lidia was born April 5, 1986 in Jorochito. She has two small children. This is the first time she has requested a loan from Emprender. The money will be used to buy seeds for growing potatoes. In addition, she will prepare some land in Elvira, which is 15km outside of Jorochito. The land belongs to her mother, but she also rents farmland for growing potatoes and corn. Once her products are harvested, she sells them at the market in El Torno.

Lidia is a young mother who has the drive to succeed. She eventually wants to buy her own land. Lidia is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting potatoes

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nerida; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la venta de artesanía como chompas, gorros, guantes, pantalones, polos entre otros más, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en el centro del cusco en una de las av. Mas importantes como es la Av.Sol, la socia está contenta con este negocio ya que mediante este ella saca su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio y así tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nerida is a member of the “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Nerida is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells hand-made items like sweaters, hats, gloves, pants, polo style shirts, and many others.  She has been in this business for years.  The business is located on one of the most important avenues, like Avenida Sol, in the center of Cusco.  She is happy with the business because it is through the business that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  That way she will have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise in order to have a greater variety to offer her customers

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena W. displays food items on a table for resale in Abura near Frami. She is married and lives together with her six dependants. Her husband is a carpenter. As a way of supporting her husband, she pays part of the utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will serve as additional income to increase her sale of food items. Her business goal is to build a shop where she can sell in.

loans.use: to increase her sale of food items.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Mariana M. bautizó su negocio como Alimentos: “L. casa D. las empanadas”, elL. tiene 6 hijos y vive con su cónyuge en “L. Heroica” como se nombra a L.  hermosa ciudad D. Cartagena D. Indias, al norte D. Colombia. DesD. muy niña se inclinó por L. preparación D. alimentos y cuando estuvo en edad D. trabajar,  se dedicó a  L. cocina en condiciones D. empleada y  allí  fue donD. se dio cuenta que podía generar ingresos independientes y comenzó preparando  y vendiendo deliciosas  tortas, a los cual fue agregando, frituras, pasabocas y finalmente tamales y pasteles ; así se dio a conocer hasta que empezó a ser contratada para bufetes, su mayor desafío es su poco capital para cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.;  por esta razón   para mejorar esta debilidad empresarial,  ha recurrido a L. Fundación Santo Domingo pues a  través D. su  línea Kiva está aplicando a un crédito, que empleará en L. compra D. materiales para L. elaboración D. tamales y D. comidas especiales que tiene encargadas. Mientras continua con el sueño D. hacer D. su negocio un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Mariana M. baptized her food business as "L. casa D. las empanadas".  She has six children and lives with her husband in "L. Heroica" which is the name given to the beautiful city of Cartagena D. Indianas in northern Colombia.  Since she was a little girl she has enjoyed cooking and as soon as she was old enough began working as a cook.  There she realized that she could generate her own income independently and began preparing and selling delicious cakes.  She then added fried foods, snacks and finally tamales and pastries.  This is how she started out and eventually was contracted by event organizers.

Her biggest challenge is the lack of capital to fill customer orders.  So to improve her company's liquidity she went to the Santo Domingo Foundation and requested a loan through Kiva.  She plans to use the loan to buy ingredients to make tamales and special foods that have already been ordered.

Her dream is to have her own grand restaurant one day.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales and special foods

loans.name: Angel Deivi

texts.es: Ángel tiene 28 años de edad es casado y tiene un hijo de 5 años que esta en el colegio, el se dedica a vender golosinas y gaseosas en una carretilla ubicada al lado del hospital Félix Torrealba, su esposa también cuenta con otro negocio donde vende jugos y desayunos en la misma zona, inicio su negocio con el apoyo de sus suegros quienes también trabajan en dicha lugar tienen trabajando en esta actividad 5 años aproximadamente y esta ganando s/250 semanal, los desafíos que el enfrenta es que aun no cuenta con casa propia viven en casa de sus suegros, su sueño en el futuro es adquirir un terreno y construirlo para brindarle una mayor comodidad a sus familia, el dinero será invertido comprar mas mercadería, golosinas gaseosa chocolates  galletas pañales entre otras cosas y así abastecer su negocio para las fiestas de semana santa es una fecha tradicional en la ciudad de ICA , fecha en las que las ventas incrementan considerablemente, ángel esta muy contento con el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Ángel is 28 years old, married, and has a child that is 5 and in school.  He dedicates himself to selling snacks and sodas from a cart located next to the Félix Torrealba hospital.  His wife also has another business selling juices and breakfasts in the same area.  He started his enterprise with the support of his in-laws, who also work in the same area.  He has been in business for 5 years, and earns 250 soles weekly.

The challenges he faces include not having his own house, therefore they live with their in-laws.  His dream for the future is to buy some land to build a house, so his family can live more comfortably.  The money will be invested into the purchase of merchandise such as snacks, sodas, chocolates, cookies and other items.  This will help him supply his business in anticipation of the Holy Week celebrations, a traditional time in the city of Ica when sales increase considerably.  Ángel is very happy for the support he is receiving.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as sodas, cookies, chocolates, and other items.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Yawa is 45 years old and married with 4 children between 18 and 30 years old. She runs a store at Grassfield in Sierra Leone.

Yawa has been in her business for 12 years, and sells clothing and drinks at her store. She says that the main challenges to her business are weather conditions and price control.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing. Yawa says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to develop her business more.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and drinks.

loans.name: Flor De Canela Group

texts.es:
El señor Rey como le dicen de cariño su familia y conocidos, el desde muy pequeño sus padres le inculcaron el amor por la tierra le enseñaron a trabajarla, dice que cuando era joven se dedico al cultivo de maíz, pero se le hizo un trabajo muy pesado y que le dejaba muy pocas ganancias. Ahora se dedica al comercio de paletas de hielo y helados, aproximadamente hace 16 años comenzó con el negocio, primero en su casa, luego en su localidad que es Curungueo y después como le fue hiendo bien se fue a otras comunidades como son Macho de Agua, Río De Guadalupe y otras comunidades, su negocio es ambulante el se pone fuera de las primarias y cuando no hay clases el vende sus paletas en las calles de las rancherías, por eso don Rey esta pidiendo su crédito a Fundación Realidad para surtir producto de helados y paletas ya que el las compra y las revende también para comprar barquillos, vaso para el helado, y comprar otra hielera por que comenta que la que tiene ya esta muy viejita.  Sus necesidades son muchas, ya que el tiene que sacar  adelante a su familia, quiere hacer unos cuartos por que ya donde viven no caben ya que todavía varios de sus hijos viven con el, comenta “Quiero darles una mejor vida comprarles mas camas para que ya no duerman todos enracimados antes no tenia piso mi casa y gracias a que he tenido mejores ventas por que he surtido mas con los créditos que me han otorgado ya le hice piso de cemento a mi casa por eso sigo trabajando con la financiera por que me ha ayudado a darle una mejor calidad de vida a mis hijos”.   El es casado desde hace treinta años con doña Amalia ellos tienen seis hijos, la mayor de nombre Mariana es casada con dos niños, luego le siguen Armando y Ángeles de 24 y 22 respectivamente, dice don Rey que ellos dos le ayudan con los gastos de la casa, a comprar el gas o la leña y al pago de la luz y cuando pueden le ayudan con los gastos de la escuela de Miriam y Liliana de 18 y 13 años, y su hija Lourdes de 20 años es madre soltera, comenta que ella ayuda en las labores del hogar. El sueña con poder darles una carrera a sus hijas y no truncarles sus sueños a ellas.   Su meta es proponerse hacer un local estable en su casa, para que su esposa doña Amalia y su hija Lourdes le ayuden a vender su producto, y mas adelante comprar un conservador para sus nieves y paletas.  
Los otros 3 integrantes se llaman Mariana, Virginia y Benito ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en  la compra  de Frutas y verduras y antojitos mexicanos (corundas).
texts.en:
His family and friends affectionately call Reynaldo Señor Rey. From an early age his parents taught him to love the land and how to work it. As a young man he grew corn but it was very hard work and brought him little profit. Now Rey sells popsicles and ice cream, a job he’s been doing for sixteen years. He started out by selling from his house, then in his community of Curungueo, and finally as all was going well, he started going to other communities such as Macho de Agua and Río De Guadalupe amongst others. He walks around to sell his wares, outside primary schools for example, and when school is out, he sells in the streets of the communities. 

Now Rey is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Realidad to buy more stock and also to buy ice cream cones, glass containers for ice cream, and another cooler as the one he has is very old.

Rey’s needs are many as he has a family to help get ahead in life. He wants to add more rooms to his home which is no longer big enough since several of his children still live at home. He says, “I want to give them a better life and buy more beds so that they don’t all sleep together. Before, my house had no floor but thankfully sales increased so I was able to take out loans and put in a concrete floor. For this reason I am still working with a finance company because it has helped me provide my children with a better quality of life.”

Rey has been married for thirty years to Sra. Amalia. They have six children. The oldest is called Mariana; she is married and has two children. Then there are Armando and Ángeles, aged 24 and 22. They both help Rey with household expenses such as buying gas or firewood, and paying the electricity bills. When they are able, they help pay for the school expenses of Miriam (18) and Liliana (13). His daughter 20-year old Lourdes is a single mother and helps with the household chores.

Rey’s dream is to help his daughters get good jobs so they don’t have to cut short their dreams. His goal is to establish a permanent store in his house so that his wife Amalia and daughter Lourdes can help him sell the products. In the future he wants to buy a freezer for the ice cream and popsicles.

The three other members of his group are Mariana, Virginia, and Benito who are seeking loans to buy fruit and vegetables, and Mexican snacks such as corundas (type of tamal sold in Michoacán).

loans.use: to buy ice cream and popsicles

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children who all attend school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 5 years now. She employs one farmhand and sells her milk, tomatoes and eggs to the local market. 

Janet has requested a loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve her family's lifestyle. Her biggest challenge in this business has been lack of enough animal feeds, especially during the dry season. She plans to have 5 dairy cows and a posho mill in the next 5 years.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dora Nelly

texts.es:
A sus 42 años de edad y después de trabajar durante en talleres de confecciones, Dora decidió comprar una máquina de coser para realizar desde su casa trabajos propios en su tiempo libre que le permitan generar ingresos adicionales para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, así como cumplir sus sueño de tener su propia casa.
 
Dora necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima como telas e insumos como hilos, botones, entre otros, que le permitan realizar mayor producción e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
After having spent many years working in sewing workshops, at the age of 42 Dora decided buying a sewing machine to work on her own in her house, making clothes in her free time to earn additional money in order to improve her family’s and her own standards of living, as well as to achieve her dream of having a house of her own.

Dora is requesting a loan to buy materials such as fabric, threads and buttons, among other things, in order to create more clothes and consequently increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads and buttons.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 51 years old and lives in Lurugan  Valencia City. She is widowed and has 4 children. 

Cristita has a shop that sells electronic loads of different networks and a general store that sells snacks, canned goods, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc.  She has had this business for 4 years.   Cristita has requested a loan for 5000 to buy additional goods to sell and electronic loads for customer usage.  

Cristita has been a member of HSPFI since just this year.  In the future, she hopes to make her store much bigger and have a more successful business.

loans.use: To buy goods and electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a businesswoman. She wants to buy goods for her grocery shop such as sugar, rice, salt, oil, etc. Joyce wants to improve her business with this loan.
Joyce is 28 years old, married and has two children, both of whom go to school. Her husband also help her in the business.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Audelio

texts.es:
Audelio tiene 59 años de edad tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 están a su cargo  el cuenta con casa propia en la que reside junto a su familia , su vivienda se localiza en el departamento de Piura  al norte del país en el distrito de Morropón   

Audelio desde hace 11 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que llegan a su crecimiento ideal los ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o los vende en el mercado de Morropón, con los ingresos que obtenga solventará sus obligaciones familiares.  

Aurelio ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para tenerlos bien alimentados y así podrá ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, además también desea realizar algunas mejoras  en su vivienda para su mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Aurelio es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Audelio is 59 and has 4 children, of whom 2 are under his care. He has his own home where he lives with his family. His home is located in the Piura department in the north of the Morropon district.

Audelio has raised and sold sheep and barnyard birds for 11 years. His corral is located in an external part of his home. He feeds his animals balanced food and natural grains. Once they reach an ideal level of development he offers them for sale to the locals or in the Morropon market. With the income that he obtains he covers his familial obligations.

Audelio has requested a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more balanced feed in order to keep the animals well-fed. This way she will be able to sell them at a better price to his customers in order to cover his loan and improve his family's quality of life. He also wants to make some home improvements for greater security and comfort. Aurelio is a hard-working and very responsible person, and the only thing that he wants is for his children to have other opportunities for education.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his animals, and to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Duterintambwe 1 Group

texts.fr:
Rebecca est une commerçante âgée de 34ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Elle vend de la bière depuis 5ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fréquentée l’école jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de caisses de bière à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUTERINTAMBWE 1 ».
texts.en:
Rebecca is a 34-year-old merchant who lives in the city of Gitega, located at the center of the country. She has been selling beer for 5 years, and she is also a farmer. She is a member of the DUTERINTAMBWE I community group.

Rebecca attended primary school. She is married with four children, two of whom go to primary school. 

The loan of 100,000 BIF will help to bolster her working capital. She will stock up on cases of beer for resale to make substantial profits.

loans.use: to stock up on cases of beer for resale

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1979 and lives in the village of Nghia Lai, Uy No commune. She has three children (two sons and a daughter). Her husband repairs bicycles and motorbikes. Her family has a store where Anh has worked for many years. The store provides a monthly income of about 7,000,000 VND.

Anh has participated in SEDA since 2005. She last borrowed 8,938,000 VND and repaid the loan punctually. This will be her 6th loan from SEDA. Anh would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en: Melecia is a married woman who earns a living through farming. She plants rice and corn crops on her land. Melecia said farming is not easy but she still strives to keep her farm productive. She applied for a loan because she does not have the capacity right now to fund her farm. She plans to use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizers and 1 liter of insecticides. In the future, Melecia hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizers and 1 liter of insecticides

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and six children. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop since 2000. His job consists of changing car wheels in addition to fixing up the ruined ones. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional materials and equipment to reinforce his business operation and further develop his work. Ahmad is sure that with the new equipment he will be able to provide his customers with high quality services.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for his business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in clothes for four years. He started his business with 2,000,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is increased prices for the clothes and his vision is a big boutique, buying vehicles and a good house. Stephen needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Grace is married and has three children. Grace is 45 years old and lives in Mahayag. 

Grace sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. 

Grace has been a member of PMPC for two years. Grace is the leader of a four person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Remedios has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 27 years old young man, he owns a taxi and works as a taxi driver with decent income. Ayman wants to improve his house by making some finishing to it such as: installing tiles, installing windows and doors,..etc, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Ayman gets the loan, he will be able to pay the expenses of finishing his house, so he will get better living conditions. Ayman is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To complete finishing his house to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 10.  In 1998, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan Business and Professional Women, and wants to use this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Pramila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Osvaldo De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Osvaldo a sus 46 años de edad es padre de tres hijos de 10, 7 y 6 años de edad. El señor Osvaldo se ha dedicado durante toda su vida a la venta de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante, es decir, en la calle sin un lugar fijo. Desde hace 6 años pudo conseguir el permiso de la entidad correspondiente, quien le brindo un espacio fijo para vender sus productos. El señor Osvaldo trabaja solo en una jornada de 9:00 am a 9:00 pm de lunes a sábado.  El señor Osvaldo desea comprar surtido de frutas como manzana, peras y uvas con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A futuro el señor Oswaldo desea tener otro negocio con el cual pueda generar empleos directos a su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Osvaldo is 46 years old and is a father to three children of 10, 7 and 6 years of age. Mr. Osvaldo has dedicated his whole life to selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor without a specific space. Six years ago he was able to get a permit that allowed him to have a permanent place to sell his merchandize. Mr. Osvaldo works only from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday. He wants to buy a variety of fruits like apples, pears and grapes to increase his income and improve the quality of life of his family. In the future, Mr. Osvaldo wishes to have another business that will allow him to create jobs for his family.

loans.use: buy a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a fishmonger who plies his trade at the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has 16 children, six of whom are in school. Besides this, Yusuf sells water, owns a barber shop, and has rental houses from which he obtains monthly rental income. 

Yusuf is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) in order to buy more fish in readiness for the Christmas festivities. 

He has set his future goals at purchasing motorcycles as this is a thriving business in Mombasa owing to the transport problems in the sector. His main challenge is the high cost of transportation since he obtains fish from upcountry (Kisumu, over 800 km away) 

The additional income from this loan will help Yusuf pay school fees for his children and also improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a grown daughter. She is a small-scale entrepreneur from Znamenka. Svetlana grows rareripes, (i.e. tomatoes and radishes) for sale in one of the local markets in her home town. Svetlana started this trade 16 years ago. Currently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas invested in her farm. Annually Svetlana spends about 8,000 – 13,000 Grivnyas  — on seeds and polyethylene film.
 
Svetlana is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to purchase a variety of clear, white and thermal films in different thicknesses for her greenhouses. She is planning to invest generated funds in further development of her business and construction of additional greenhouses on her plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and polyethylene greenhouse covering

loans.name: Leslie Marcela

texts.es:
Leslie es una mujer relativamente joven, tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y su hija de 11 años.

Ella inició sus estudios universitarios en Administración de Empresas, pero por sus obligaciones familiares tuvo que suspender. Pero espera continuarlos a corto plazo. 

Ella siempre trabajó como asalariada, pero el querer estar con su hija la hace renunciar . 

Como siempre le ha gustado tener independencia económica, hace unos cursos de capacitación, para aprender a cortar cabello, aplicar tintes y otros químicos, hacer manicure y pedicure como forma de genar ingresos ,que le permiten independencia y apoyar con los gastos de su familia.

Ella en este momento ofrece servicios  de estilista a domicilio a mujeres,que se lo solicitan.Lo organiza por citas previas, preferiblemente durante el tiempo que su hija está en la escuela , durante las mañanas y hasta como al medio día. En las tardes atiende  a su hija y las labores domésticas.

Este crédito es importante para ella y el desarrollo de su negocio, porque puede afiliarse a las casa proveedoras de productos logrando descuentos y contar con inventario disponible  de productos lo que le dará mejores precios y mayor liquidez.  Su meta es lograr un negocio estable y competitivo.
texts.en:
Leslie is a relatively young woman; she’s 34 years old.  She lives with her husband and 11-year-old daughter.  She started studying Business Administration in university but due to family obligations had to drop out but she expects to restart her studies soon.  She always worked as a salaried employee but because she wanted to stay home with her daughter she resigned.

Because she’s always enjoyed being economically independent she took some courses to learn how to cut and color hair and how to apply other chemicals and how to do manicures and pedicures as a way of earning income that will allow her to be independent and help with family expenses.

At present, she provides styling services at her customers’ homes to women who request them.  She organizes them based on prior appointments preferably during the time her daughter is at school during the mornings and up to about noon.  In the afternoon she tends to her daughter and her household chores.

This loan is important for her and for her business’ development because she wants to affiliate herself with a firm that distributes the products so that she can qualify for discounts and have product inventory on hand which will mean better prices and more liquidity.  Her goal is to attain a stable, competitive business.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Patricia Modestine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 40 ans, commerçante depuis bientôt 3 ans, quand elle réussit a son bac, ne voulant pas aller a l'université,avec ses économies , elle ouvre un magasin d'alimentation ou elle vend un peu de tout , conserves, pâtes alimentaires , savons, produits de lessives, bidon d'huile, sac de sucre et de farine...

Il y'a maintenant une année , elle est cliente de Hope, a l'octroi de ses prêts , elle ne pense qu'a renforcer le stock des marchandises de son magasin,avec ce nouveau prêt elle a fait autant en ajoutant dix bidons d'huile, 20 sacs de farine, des cartons de conserves et des cartons de savons de lessive ..
Tres ambitieuse , elle tient a aller loin et a l'intention de d'être une grande importatrice des denrées alimentaires.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 40-year-old woman who became a merchant nearly three years ago. Rather than attend university after completing her bachelor’s degree, she opted to use her savings to open a grocery store where she sells a little of everything including canned goods, pasta, soap, laundry detergent, oil, sugar, flour, etc. 

She became a member of Hope a year ago and has been using her credits to replenish her stock of merchandise. With this new loan, she plans to do the same by purchasing 10 jugs of oil, 20 sacks of sugar, cartons of canned goods, and boxes of laundry detergent.

Very ambitious and determined to be successful, she plans to become a major importer of food products.

loans.use: to buy pasta, oil, sugar, canned goods, and laundry detergent.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Rodelyn has a food/retail shop or 'sari-sari' store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for almost six  years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

 Rodelyn joined HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Rodelyn hopes to improve her business to benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell (groceries, snacks, drinks)

loans.name: Luvsankhuu

texts.en: Mr. Luvsankhuu, 29 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a bottled water salesman at a private company since 2010. He also has a part-time position driving for a transportation company. The house he lives in has been deteriorating over the years. So he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en: Hanady is now in her third year at the university majoring in International Relations and Strategic Studies. Her husband is ‎retired form his work with his low pension, therefore she is applying to another loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees. ‎Hanady is eager to work in her study field after getting her Bachelors.‎

loans.use: To pay for upcoming semester

loans.name: Gnapoté

texts.en:
Born in Lomé in 1952, Mrs. Gnapoté A. is married and the mother of six (06) children, with one domestic staff member. She is a vendor of various products. Her husband, a taxi driver who is no longer working, now barely contributes anything to the household’s needs. This means that his wife must bear all the expenses. Despite her enthusiasm and good faith, she is limited by her resources. Mrs. A. has thus decided to ask for financial support to expand her business. The $550 credit that she is seeking will serve as seed money to buy a variety of products in order to expand her selection. Her experience is a useful asset in making her business profitable and earning a substantial income to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1952 à Lomé, Madame A. Gnapoté est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants avec un domestique à charge. Elle est commerçante de produits divers. Son mari, un chauffeur de taxi qui n’est plus en activité, ne contribue presque plus dans les besoins du foyer. Ainsi, toutes les dépenses reviennent à la femme. Malgré son ardeur et sa bonne foi, elle est limitée par les moyens. Elle décide alors de solliciter un appui financier pour élargir son commerce. Le crédit de $550 qu’elle demande va donc servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat des produits divers afin d’agrandir son étalage. Son expérience est un bon atout pour rentabiliser ses activités et dégager un revenu substantiel pour les besoins sa famille.

loans.use: Selling various products

loans.name: Noor Zai

texts.en: Noor Zai is 32 years old with a household of five. He lives in District 17 Kabul, Afghanistan. Noor Zai has been in the taxi business for seven years. He works seven days a week to earn income to support his family. In order to keep his taxi in good operating order, he needs to buy new tires and tubes, so he is requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and tubes for taxi

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en: Rafiq N. is 45, and he is married with one child. In 1996, he borrowed a $1200 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU and with it he opened a chemist’s and optic  shop. Now he is a successful businessman. With this new loan, he is going to move from his permanent place to a larger one in downtown Sabirabad.

loans.use: Mr. Najafov would like to move his store to a larger one in downtown Sabirabad.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a mother of six, five of whom are in school. Her father died when she was young and she didn't have  the opportunity to go to school. That’s why she has made up her mind to give the best of education to her children. Realizing the heavy school needs, she vowed to work very hard and sought assistance from GHAPE. She joined the program in 2004. Since her restaurant is located near a school, there is always a ready market. School children have been benefiting a lot from her activities as they always have something to eat in the morning and during break. Given a loan of $300, Martha plans to buy Koki beans, palm oil, flour, yeast and sugar. She plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Cooking and selling of food

loans.name: Salvadora Natividad

texts.es:
Salvadora Natividad R. S. is from Bluefields. She is 44 years old and is the single mother of three children, who are 14, 8, and 6 years old. She has 18 years of experience in making gold and silver into rings, earrings, bracelets, and chains. With this job, she has been able to pay her children’s school fees. Her customers are parents of students in the city of Bluefields who prefer her because of her accessible prices. She buys each gram of gold for $8.00, $1.00 per gram of silver, $3.00 per metallic paste, and $5.00 per dozen stones to decorate the rings.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Salvadora Natividad R. S. es originaria de Bluefields tiene 44 años y es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 14,8 y 6 años.Tiene 18 años de experiencia en la transformación del oro y la plata en anillos, aretes, pulseras y cadenas con este trabajo a podido costear los estudios de sus tres hijos. Sus clientes son padres de familia de esta ciudad de Bluefields que la prefieren porque tiene precios accesibles. Ella compra cada gramo de oro a 8 dólares,cada gramo de plata a 1 dólar, la libra de acido a 4 dólares, cada pasta metalica a 3 dólares, la docena de piedras para decorar los anillos a 5 dólares.

loans.use: She will buy 31 grams of gold, 30 grams of silver, 1 metalic paste, 2 pounds of acid, and 3½ dozen stones for graduation rings.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio is 53 years old and married with 4 children. He is the owner of a business that sells bags made of polyethylene. He has been involved in this business for more than 20 years, which has allowed him to build his own house, support his entire family, and educate his children. Currently, he has a good number of customers and clients to whom he sells and supplies his products in the regions of San Bernardino, Altos, Ypacaraí, Pirayú, Caacupé, and Tobatí. He transports his products by means of motorcycle as the majority of his customers are stores, mini-markets, etc.

Currently, he is working on opening a store in the city of Ypacaraí to market his products or independently sell them door-to-door to homes, which will possibly increase his sales. One of Eugenio's worries is that he cannot provide opportunities for young people, which is why even his daughters left for Spain in search of work since there are no available jobs in his country. He seeks a loan to buy more bags.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Eugenio tiene 53 años está casado y tiene 4 hijos, el es propietario de un negocio que se dedica a vender bolsas de polietileno, en ésta actividad está hace más de 20 años, manifiesta que gracias a éste trabajo pudo hacerse de casa propia, mantener a toda su familia e inclusive educar a sus hijos. Actualmente posee buena cantidad de clientela a quienes provee de estas mercaderías y las mismas son de la zona de San Bernardino, Altos, Ypacaraí, Pirayú, Caacupé, Tobatí. La distribución de sus mercaderías lo realiza en su motocicleta y sus clientelas en su mayorías son las despensas, minimercados, copetines, etc.

Actualmente tiene proyectado abrir un local en la ciudad de Ypacaraí dónde pueda ofrecer y vender éstos productos e independientemente a las ventas a domicilio que lo realiza, esto le permitirá tener una mayor posibilidad de vender más. Una de las preocupaciones del señor Eugenio es la falta de oportunidad laboral muy en especial para los jóvenes ya que por esa razón una de sus hijas tuvo que viajar a España en busca de un trabajo ya que aquí en nuestro país no lo encontró. Solicita el crédito para la compra de bolsas de polietileno.

loans.use: to buy polyethylene bags of different colors and sizes

loans.name: Teresa De La Cruz

texts.en:
Teresa and her partner have three children. She is a very young entrepreneur who has been selling women´s clothing for one year now. She obtains garments from Santo Domingo, the Dominican Republic's capital, as well as from the Fleet Market at very low prices.

Teresa hopes to increase her income significantly. With her Kiva loan, she plans to buy clothing in bulk. That way, she won´t have to make frequent trips outside her community to get the clothing. Teresa hopes her business becomes successful so that she can continue providing education for her children. Teresa says her family is very needy, and that she is working hard to change their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Since he was very young, Erasmo M. has been in touch with the countryside. His family dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables. Ever since he was young, he imagined he’d be in the business of selling produce. And, fortunately, he realized this dream. At the age of 16, he began to sell fruit and vegetables in small markets. Nevertheless, little by little, he was saving money so he could set up his own shop. And now he is located in a shop that is on an avenue where there is a lot of traffic. Thanks to his efforts and the love he has for this business, Erasmo’s business has been growing gradually.

Nevertheless, Erasmo believes it is the time to inject more capital into the business so that he can buy at wholesale and obtain better prices. As a result, he is soliciting a credit of US $650, which he will repay in 6 months. With your help, Erasmo will be able to move his business forward and offer his wife and three children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Erasmo M., desde muy pequeño estuvo en contacto con el campo. En su familia se dedicaban a cultivar sus frutas y verduras. Desde pequeño que se imaginaba que de grande tendría un negocio de venta de verduras. Y afortunadamente a sabido encausar este sueño.
