Hace 16 años que comenzó a vender frutas y verduras en los mercaditos. Sin embargo poco a poco fue juntando dinero para poder establecerse en un local. Y ahora ya se encuentra ubicado en un local que está sobre una avenida en donde transita mucha gente. Gracias a su esfuerzo y el amor que le tiene a este negocio que su local ha ido creciendo poco a poco.

Sin embargo Erasmo considera que es momento de inyectarle más capital para así poder comprar a mayoreo y obtener mejores precios. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses con tu ayuda Erasmo podrá sacar adelante su negocio y con esto poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su esposa y sus tres hijos.

loans.use: Purchase produce.

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en: Amaka A. is married with 3 children. She is 32 years old and comes from the Ajagbandi area of Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and drinks and has been in business since 2000. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more drinks and food items for sale

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food items for sale

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Madinah N.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Madinah is 33 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 8 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Madinah makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save. Madinah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Madinah is joined in her small group by Ruth B., Robinah K., Deziranta N., and Lakele N.. Ruth B. has a business selling charcoal and wants to open a business in another location. Robinah K. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add more stock. Deziranta N. operates a beauty salon business and wants to add more equipment. Lakele N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase a bicycle to transport the charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 41 years old and has four children, ages 20, 18, 17 and 9. She and her husband also take care of three other people, ages 50, 7 and 5 years old.

Hamida is a brickmaker and seller, she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her brickmaking and can earn a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

In the past, Hamida has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more cement, sand and other equipment for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cement, sand and other equipment for her brickmaking business.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Binta D., 28 years old and unmarried, is a highly involved member of the village bank of Sinthiang Houlata. She would like to strengthen her clothing business by buying men's clothing, shoes, and perfumes. Her income will allow her to take care of her needs and meet her obligations. Bina is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Binta D., 28 ans, célibataire est une membre très assidu du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata Elle veut renforcer son commerce d’habillement en achetant des vêtements hommes, des chaussures et des parfums ,. Ses revenus lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de respecter ses engagements. Binta sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes, and perfumes

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim C. is a villager in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is currently employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Rom Roeurng, collects recyclables and is a farmer. Mrs. Sim C. is 33 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the remaining three attend school.

Even though the family members have different business activities, they are still in poor condition. Thus, Mrs. Sim C. would like to start a cow breeding business. She asked for a loan to buy a cow. Previously, Mrs. Sim C. obtained a loan to buy a pig to raise. Last year, her husband, Mr. Rom Roeurng, got high blood pressure and Mrs. Sim C. spent $750 to have him cured. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for a breeding business.

loans.name: Ky Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ky Thi N. is a 47 year old woman. She has been participating in TYM program since 2002. She invested the first loan of 500,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in a live-stock project, whose benefit was 200,000 Vietnamese Dong. With the next loans, she continued to invest in live-stock and, besides, started rice-milling. Every day, she buys paddy rice and mills it to sell. This business, to her family, is relatively financially beneficial. At the moment, her husband and children are in charged of farming, while she spends more time on rice-milling. Besides income from those sources, they also receive her husband’s monthly pension; therefore, her family’ financial situation is relatively good in the local area. She plans to borrow the next loan of 18,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more inventory paddy rice. The family’s income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Kỳ năm nay 47 tuổi. Chị Kỳ bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 500.000đ và sử dụng để chăn nuôi. Kết thúc dự án chị thu được 200.000đ tiền lãi. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị vay vốn để tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm thêm nghề hàng sáo. Hàng ngày chị đi mua thóc về sau đó say thành gạo để bán. Công việc này cũng đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao cho gia đình. Hiện nay chồng và các con của chị đảm nhiệm công việc chăn nuôi còn chị đầu tư thời gian và vốn vào nghề hàng sáo để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và buôn bán hàng tháng chồng chị còn có thêm nguồn thu ổn định từ lương hưu vì thế gia đình chị là một trong những hộ có kinh tế khá tại địa phương. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 18.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thóc về dự trữ và sát gạọ bán dần.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rice-milling

loans.name: Thi Da's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Da (ID Number 03060008), born in 1960, would like to borrow 3,132,000VND. She has four grown-up children, the eldest one is already married and the other three have been working with a stable income. Mrs. Da is a reliable and responsible person so she was voted to be the group leader. She would like to obtain this loan to invest in raising livestock and making tofu. Her family's average monthly income is 3,500,000VND (about 233USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. D. Thi Duyen (ID Number 03060012), born in 1966, would like to borrow 3,132,000VND to buy eggs to sell. Her average monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 200USD).
  • Mrs. T. Thi Lien (ID Number 03060013), born in 1980, would like to borrow 1,044,000VND to breed chickens. Her average monthly income is 2,000,000VND (about 133USD).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Doi (ID Number 03060014), born in 1953, would like to borrow 3,132,000VND to raise livestock. Her average monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 200USD).
  • Mrs. P. Thi Ha (ID Number 03060010), born in 1970, would like to borrow 348,000VND to sell leaves for wrapping rice cakes. Her average monthly income is 2,000,000VND (about 133USD).
  • Mrs. H. Thi Khanh (ID Number 03060011), born in 1973, would like to borrow 3,132,000VND to rainse livestock and invest in her general store. Her average monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 133USD).
  • The total amount requested is 850.00USD

    • Translated from Vietnamese by P. Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer.

     Trần Thị Đà, sinh năm 1960, MS(03060008), mức vay 3.132.000 đồng. Cô có 4 cháu đã trưởng thành, cháu lớn đã có gia đình, 3 cháu còn lại đã đi làm có thu nhập về cho gia đình. Cô là người có uy tín với bà con trong làng nên cả nhóm vay vốn bầu cô làm nhóm trưởng. Vợ chồng cô vay vốn đầu tư làm đậu và chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000 đồng/tháng. Trông nhóm cô còn có: - Đỗ Thị Duyên, sinh năm 1966, MS(03060012), mức vay 3.132.000 đồng. Chị vay vốn đầu tư đi chợ buôn trứng, thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000 đồng/tháng - Trần Thị Liên, sinh năm 1980, MS(03060013), mức vay 1.044.000 đồng. Chị vay vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi gà, thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000 đồng/tháng - Nguyễn Thị Đợi, sinh năm 1953, MS(03060014), mức vay 3.132.000 đồng. Cô vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi, thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000 đồng/tháng - Phạm Thị Hạ, sinh năm 1970, MS(03060010), mức vay 348.000 đồng. Chị vay vốn đi chợ bán lá dong gói bánh, thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000 đồng/tháng - Hoàng Thị Khánh, sinh năm 1973, MS(03060011), mức vay 3.132.000 đồng. Chị vay vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi và bán hàng tạp hóa, thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000 đồng/tháng.

loans.use: Raising livestock and retailing

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Абдиев Шавкат проживает вместе со своей семьей в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 39 лет и 15 из них он занимается торговлей мяса. Покупает бычков и реализует в розницу на центральном рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет снабжать рынок свежим мясом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abidev Shavkat lives with his family in the Jaloluddini Rumi district. He is married and has four children. He is 39 years old, and has been a meat seller for 15 of those years. He buys bull calves and sells retail at the central market. He decided to obtain a loan to increase sales. This will help supply fresh meat for the market. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Marcia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Marcia tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Monseñor Lezcano de donde fue el banco popular 4 ½ c al lago, casada y con tres hijos  de 16, 20 y 22 años de edad, uno de ello estudia la secundaria, y los otros dos trabajan y apoyan en los gastos de la familia su esposo se desempeña como conductor. Doña Marcia vende ropa desde hace cuatro años e inicio con capital propio con ayuda de su esposo, vende al contado y al crédito, con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en inventario en la compra de ropa variada para niños y adultos, lo cual para estas fechas las ventas son buenas, y desea también poder cumplir con unos encargos de ropa de sus clientes.
A largo plazo es captar más clientela, incrementar las ventas, y poder hacer mejoras a su casa para gozar de una vivienda digna con su familia, también a ayudar a su hijo  con los estudios.
texts.en:
Marcia is 42 years old and lives in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married and has three children ages 16, 20 and 22. One is in high school and the others work and help with the family's expenses. Her husband works as a conductor. Marcia has been selling clothes for four years. She started the business with her own money and with the help of her husband. She takes cash and credit payments. She will use the money from this loan to purchase a variety of clothing for children and adults as this clothing sells well during this time of year. She will also use the loan proceeds to fill some orders from her clients. Her long term goals are to attract more clients, to increase her sales, and to be able to make improvements to her home so that she can enjoy a worthy home with her family and to help her son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet A. is 38 years old and married without children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She owns a store where she sells drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs.  Juliet does not have a deep freezer to cool her drinks to sell, and her customers go to other stores to buy cold drinks.  She needs the loan amount of N81,000 to buy a deep freezer to cool her drinks.  She will also use some part of the loan to buy more provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen O. O. is 42 years old and she is married with three children. Helen lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells sarongs and firewood. Helen needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs and firewood to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and firewood to sell

loans.name: Yeur

texts.en: Mr. Yeur Y. is a villager in Svay Prey village in Kampong Cham province. He is a pig breeder. Because this business is going well, he wants to expand it; so he decided to ask for a loan to buy three more pigs for breeding. He would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to feed his pigs. His wife, Mrs. Mon Tha, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mr. Yeur Y. is 27 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only three years old. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy three more pigs and pig food for his pig breeding business.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
Orifjon M. is 25 years old. He is married and has 3 kids. Orifjon's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God will continue to provide him with a longer life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Dushanbe, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for 4 years.

Currently Orifjon’s car needs some repairing and he wants to borrow 2500 Somoni for the term of 12 months. The financing will go towards repairs of his vehicle and also, together with the parts, he will purchase winter tires. Orifjon thanks Kiva and all the lenders that make this help possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for thorough repair of his taxi

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 55 años y vive con sus 3 hijos en su propia casa. Se dedica a la fabricación de chompas de lana a menor escala, sus tejidos son a mano y a máquina y lo viene haciendo desde hace 10 años por la demanda de estas prendas de vestir que combaten el clima frío de su zona y más todavía en época de invierno. Su forma de trabajo consiste en elaborar ella misma las chompas que requieren casi todo el día de su tiempo, lo bueno es que trabaja en la comodidad de su casa de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana los vende. Debido a la calidad de sus trabajos sus propios vecinos hacen varios pedidos y es así que Delfina tiene proyectos de seguir adelante y de crecer, como tener un local comercial donde pueda exhibir todos sus trabajos. Es la segunda vez que  Delfina solicita un préstamo en MFP, ella está trabajando por la unión de su grupo a la cual ella guarda mucho aprecio por ser un espacio de amistad. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de lana en grandes cantidades, para elaborar chompas delgadas comprará lana delgada valorizada en 20 soles el paquete de 1 kilo y otras variedades con lo que cubrirá la totalidad de lo solicitado.
texts.en:
Delfina is 55 years old and lives with her three children in her own home. She works making wool sweaters by hand and by machine. She has done this for 10 years because there is so much demand for this clothing to combat the her region's cold climate, especially in the wintertime. She works alone making sweaters almost the whole day, but the good part is that she can work in the comfort of her own home Monday to Friday and sell the sweaters on the weekends. Due to the quality of her work her own neighbors make various requests so that Delfina has projects lined up in advance and will be able to grow. She hopes to have a kiosk where she can exhibit her work. This is the second time Delfina has requested a loan through MFP. She is part of the association and she values this group for being a place of friendship. The money she asks for will be used to buy large quantities of wool. For knitting light sweaters she will buy lightweight yarn worth 20 soles (about $6.00 USD) a package and with the remaining money she will buy other varieties of wool.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool for knitting

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Pendo M. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 9 years old.

Pendo has been running a tailoring business since 2007. Her business is to purchase vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and make them into clothing, mainly for women.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Pendo currently earns about $180 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides). In the future, she plans to expand her business. Pendo thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides)

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa S. a pour l’activité la vente de savon et le savon en poudre pour faire la lessive.  Cette vielle dame habite à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale à 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Elle a fait ce commerce depuis 8 ans, donc elle est bien expérimentée dans ce commerce, et elle est mariée avec des enfants.  Avec ce crédit, elle va reconstituer son stock pour mieux servir ses clients.  Avec les revenus de son entreprise elle aide à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa S. has a business selling soap and powdered laundry soap. She is an elderly woman who lives in Diourbel, a small rural city located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She has been in this business for eight years, so she is very experienced in this field. She is married and has children. With this loan, she's going to replenish her stock to serve her customers better. With the revenues from her enterprise, she helps with supporting her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Bah Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Bah Oumou Sangaré a 46 ans, mariée et mère de huit enfants dont cinq garçons et trois filles. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs  enfants à Hamdallaye Extension, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette femme s’est initiée   aux activités de teinture et de vente de bazins teintés. Elle  a appris la teinture auprès de sa grande sœur il y a dix neuf  ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  pour la qualité de ses produits et reçoit beaucoup de commandes. En plus de son activité principale, elle fait le stockage et la commercialisation de céréales.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant trois  ans. Elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 2 pièces de bazins blancs “Riche Hollandais” , 10 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes, 10 paquets de soudes caustiques. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali) mais aussi à Sikasso auprès des grands commerçants avant de les donner différentes colories pour  ensuite les revendre au comptant, à crédit et sur commande à une clientèle composée de routiers et de Sikassois résidant ailleurs.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bah Oumou Sangaré, 46 , is married and the mother of eight children, 5 boys and 3 girls. She lives with her husband and their children in Hamdallaye Extension, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having had to chance to do well in school due to socio-economic reasons, this lady learned to do dyeing and to sell hand-dyed damask ("bazin") cloth. She learned to do dyeing from her older sister 19 years ago. She is much in demand for the quality of her products and receives a lot of orders. Besides her main business, she warehouses and sells cereals.

Wishing to better satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to become a member of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. She is on her 5th individual loan and all the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. With this loan she intends to buy 2 bolts of white damask "Riche Hollandais”, 10 boxes of various color dyes, and 10 packets of caustic soda. She does her buying in Bamako (capital of Mali) but also in Sikasso from the big merchants before dyeing the fabric in different colors and selling it for cash and credit and on order, to a clientele composed of long-distance drivers and of people from Sikasso who live elsewhere.

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 300,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of un-dyed damask, caustic soda, and dye

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto tiene una casa de interés social y su esposa esta embarazada y desean construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás para que su futuro hijo tenga su propia recamara. El señor siempre ve por el bienestar de su familia lo cual  quiere que vivan cómodamente y dejar un buen patrimonio a su familia. Para empezar su proyecto el necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra e ir iniciando para que este antes del nacimiento de su bebe.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto has a house through public housing, and his wife is pregnant. They wish to construct a room in the back part so that their future child would have his own room. Carlos always looks to the well-being of his family, and he wants them to live comfortably and to provide a good patrimony to his family. To begin his protection he needs to buy material and to pay workmen to begin before the birth of his baby.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Modesta Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Yolanda vende calzados y ropa de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza de casa en casa a amigos y familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados.
Los sueños de Yolanda son mejorar su negocio, tener una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of Triunfo ("Triumph") Communal Bank. She is married, 46 years old, and has 4 children. Yolanda sells shoes and clothing as requested by her customers. She gets her products in Lima and sells them door to door among friends and acquaintances. Yolanda needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase shoes. Yolanda's dreams are to improve her business, to have a store, and that her children grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes

loans.name: Yrma Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Yrma Alvina R. Rodríguez tiene 49 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Incompleta, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Yrma se dedica a la Crianza y Venta de animales menores, madera este negocio se inicio hace 20 años, su negocio se desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invertirá  en la compra de animales menores como cuyes, pollos, patos también hace eventos como polladas para vender.
Yrma tiene como sueño tener granja para  Vender animales por mayor y menor para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Yrma Alvina R. Rodríguez is 49 years old. She lives in the Victor Raúl II human settlement, Porvenir district, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied in, but did not complete, a higher education. She has one daughter who depends on her economically.

Yrma raises and sells young animals. She began this business 20 years ago. She runs her business from home.

The first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank, Lideres en Acción II (Leaders in Action II), will be invested in young animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and also ducks. She has events such as polladas (neighborhood barbeques) to sell her chicken.

Yrma dreams to have a farm from which to sell her animals by retail and in bulk and to grow as a small business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and also ducks and have polladas (neighborhood barbeques) to sell her chicken.

loans.name: Kipkemei Arap

texts.en: Mr. L. is 69 years old, married, and the father of six children. He has been in the brick-moulding business for the past three years. He intends to utilize this loan to assist him in hiring additional workers, to pay for water, and to buy firewood and grass for the preparation of bricks. These items will enable him to increase his current output and thus improve his income level. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase wood and grass for seasoning bricks

loans.name: Kikelomo

texts.en:
Kikelomo is an advanced woman who sells provisions and soap in cartons. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. Kikelomo is 56 years old and married with 3 children.

Kikelomo has been borrowing from lapo for the past 2 years. Kikelomo is very happy because the loan has sustained her business. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and soap to sell. She thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and soap to sell

loans.name: Ngang

texts.en:
Ngang P. is a father of five and widower of two separate wives. All the way back in 1998, P. joined GHAPE to be able to provide his family with a brighter future. He received training from our organization and has also invested in farming and pig rearing. 

Coming back to our organization, P. is looking for a loan to be able to start a firewood selling business. In this area, it is very common for people to use fires rather than stoves for their cooking, and P. sees that there is much need for greater access to this resource. That being the case, P. is looking to buy a hammer, chisel, axe and wood to be able to distribute his firewood throughout the community. 

With his past loan activity, P. invested the gains in educating his children, improving his home, buying piglets for his farm, and for trading in his community. This next loan will also be used for some of the same purposes. P. would like to continue his children’s education and ensure their good health, and he would also like continue improving his home, being able to plaster the walls of his house. He is sure that this business will succeed because of the large market demand and because of his ability to sell the wood at a reasonable price.

P. originally came to GHAPE because of the reasonable rates on the loans and also because of what he has gotten out of them. He has learned how to manage his money, how to run a profitable farm, and has also learned about how to educate his children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of hammer, chisel, axe, firewood, transport of materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. C. sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen at the sea shore and then sends it to the market at Elmina to sell. Esther has no educational background.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a prison officer. Esther has been selling fish since 2008. Her income helps support the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
La señora Inés C.  trabajadora, entusiasta y emprendedora tiene 49 años D. edad y casada con 3 hijos. Actualmente asume  el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Paz y Progreso”.
Viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace  5 años, su alcancía comunal esta integrada por  12 socios, quienes  realizan diferentes actividades como: producción, comercio y servicio.
Inés se conoció con su esposo en  una renovadora D. calzados ambos trabajaban ahí, se enamoraron, se casaron y decidieron abrir su propio negocio, con la denominación  la renovadora “Enciso” en el cual ambos trabajan y  se dedican a la renovación, confección y venta D. calzados desD. hace más D. 10 años y para incrementar los ingresos en el hogar Inés también trabaja prestando  servicios D. limpieza D. hogar desD. hace 4 años.
Su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en comprar materiales para su renovadora como: pegamentos, hormas, cueros, suelas, clavos, etc. 
Inés en el futuro le gustaría mucho ser exportadora D. calzado y también aperturar una bodega  en casa.
texts.en:
Señora Inés C., an enthusiastic and enterprising worker, is 49 years old, married with three children. Currently, she is taking on the position of president of the “Paz y Progreso” (Peace and Progress) community bank.  

She has been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for 5 years.  Her community bank is maD. up of 12 members who engage in different business like production, trading, and services.

Inés met her husband in a shoe repair shop where they both worked.  They fell in love, got married, and decided to open their own business, with the name “Enciso”.  They both work there and have been involved in the repair, making, and sale of footwear for more than 10 years.  In order to add to the household income, Inés has also worked at providing house cleaning services for 4 years.  

This loan will be invested in the purchase of materials for her shoe repair business, such as glue, molds, leather, soles, nails, etc.  In the future, Inés would very much like to be an exporter of footwear and also to have a grocery store in her house.

loans.use: She will invest in purchasing materials for her shoe repair business such as glue, molds, leather, soles, nails, etc.

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr: Koku T. est un homme âgé de 61 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite à Kpadapé, un village situé à 10 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un enseignant retraité. Avec ce crédit, il estimerait achever sa maison afin de ne plus payer les frais de location. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koku T. is 61 years old, married and father of four children. He lives in Kpadapé, a village located about 10 kilometers from Kpalimé. He is a retired teacher. With this loan, Mr T. hopes to finish building his house in order to stop paying rental costs. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building his house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 55 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales, uno de ellos aun vive con él y su esposa en su casa. Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura y esta actividad lo llena de mucha alegría y satisfacción, en especial cuando sus cultivos lucen como se muestra en la foto. Por ello, muy entusiasmado Pedro nos contó sobre el resultado de abonar y fumigar sus plantas para que estén saludables. Esto le da la esperanza de que sus cosechas serán exitosas y abundantes, y por ende, muy rentables. Pedro comercializa sus productos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, que es donde todos los agricultores de las zonas rurales llevan sus productos, por ser éste el nexo a los mercados de la capital (Lima), y sobre todo porque rápidamente puede obtener el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Pedro estuvo un tiempo retirado de su banco comunal, pero esta vez retorna con la oportunidad de un nuevo crédito que impulse el crecimiento de sus cultivos, por lo que se compromete a no defraudar la confianza de todo el grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus próximas siembras en terrenos temporales (según la lluvia).

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn C. would like to take out a loan of $1000 US to complete her house construction. She is a professional tailor who is able to make $2 US profit every day. Her husband is a construction worker building houses and earning $3 US per day. Chorn C. is 48 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. This couple has three children: two are garment factory workers and one is a student. 
Chorn is pictured with her husband and her mother.

loans.use: To complete her house construction

loans.name: Gustavo Alejandro

texts.es:
El caballero Gustavo M. es padre de dos pequeños niños a los cuales debe de mantener y proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo brindándoles una vivienda digna donde puedan habitar.

El problema que por varios años ha atravesado es que su vivienda no está en buenas condiciones porque ha sido afectada por los fenómenos climatológicos y esto se puede convertir en un peligro para sus hijos así que solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción y así mejorar su vivienda para el bienestar de sus hijos y el resto de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Gustavo Mejia is the father of two small children, who he must support and provide a good home to. The problem he has had for a number of years is that his home is not in good condition because it’s been affected by the weather. This could be unsafe for his children. He is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials to improve his home for the well being of his children and the rest of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Construction Material

loans.name: Seta

texts.en:
Seta P. is a 20-year-old woman living in the town of Falelima.  She is single and does not have any chlidren.  To make a living, Seta grows and sells a variety of vegetables.  Seta has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 150 Samoan tala (about $60 US) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Seta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Seta is requesting her first loan from SPBD, 750 tala which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Seta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa G. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Elsa is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be invested in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om S., 43, is married and lives with her four children and husband in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she sells a variety of groceries in her village.  She earns $3 per day.  Her husband is a police officer who earns $4 per day.  S. and her family members want to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI. In the future, she hopes to run a big store, selling groceries to her new and existing customers.  She also wants her children to finish high school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 38 years old. He is married with five children. His children are still young and dependent. He owns a restaurant where he sells Nigerian cooked food and drinks. His wife also assists him in his restaurant business. He loves cooking and that is why he commercialized his cooking skills to make money. Joseph hopes to see his restaurant business grow bigger and attract more customers. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1970, D. Justine réside depuis 17 ans à Djèrègbé Gbokpa, à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Justine est mariée à HOUNNEHEKPON Marcellin, un maçon. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs deux parents à Djèrègbé. Justine vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Justine n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a un an de cela que Justine a commencé la vente de produits divers (savons de lessive "Klin" et lait "Jago") à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Justine s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Justine a obtenu deux fois de crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Justine ambitionne diversifier et élever le niveau de son activité, pour mieux satisfaire la demande des clients. Cependant Justine ne dispose pas des moyens financiers nécessaires pour y parvenir. C'est la raison pour laquelle Justine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1970, D. Justine has resided for seventeen years in Djèrègbé Gbokpa, a few kilometers from Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to HOUNNEHEKPON Marcellin, a mason. The couple has five children to support, of whom four are their own. The children are all in school and live together with their parents in Djèrègbé. Justine helps out her husband where it concerns the different family expenses thanks to the revenues her business brings in. Justine never attended school. A year ago, she started selling various goods (Klin laundry soap and Jago milk) at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She stocks up from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. Justine has twice obtained ALIDé loans, which she has repaid. Her ambition is to diversify her business and to raise its level in order to satisfy customer demand more. However, she lacks the necessary financial means to do so. For these reasons, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of KLIN soap and boxes of JAGO products

loans.name: Rai

texts.en:
Mrs. Rai E. (shown in the photo), age 50, and her husband, Mr. Phat Sam, age 50, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1985 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. One of their sons assists his parents in farming and the other three are in school. 

Rai and her husband have been farming for 20 years. The couple hopes to increase their volume and productivity because their family depends on farming for their income and financial support. Rai is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Mrs. Marites G. is from the village of Lumipac, Baliangao Mis. Occ. She is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture in retail sector which is selling of dried goods and beauty products from natasha,avon, and MSE in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earned 5,000.00 monthly net from the said business. In 2006, Marites joined PMPC to gain access the programs and services of the said COOP. Currently, she's availing her 7th cycle loan in the amount of 25,000.00 which will be used for additional investment and working capital for her existing business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital of her existing business

loans.name: La Esperanza Del Valle Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. SARA EDITH, TIENE TIENE 27 AÑOS D. EDAD, Y TIENE DOS HIJOS MENORES D. EDAD. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "LA ESPERANZA DEL VALLE" Y FUÉ RECIENTEMENTE ELEGIDA POR SUS NUEVE COMPAÑERAS COMO PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. SARA EDTH SE DEDICA DESD. HACE SEIS MESES A LA VENTA AMBULATORIA D. PAPA RELLENA, QUE ELLA PREPARA TODAS LAS MAÑANAS Y SALE A DIFERENTES LOZAS DEPORTIVAS Y RECORRE LAS CALLES OFRECIENDO SUS PAPAS RELLENAS.
APROVECHANDO EL CARISMA QUE TIENE, YA QUE ES MUY ALEGRE Y AMIGABLE, UNA AMIGA LE DIÓ LA IDEA D. INVERTIR EN EL NEGOCIO D. COMIDA, CON EL CUAL HA PODIDO SOSTENER A SU FAMILIA, A SUS DOS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA ES PADRE Y MADRE PARA ELLOS, SOBRETODO HA PODIDO SOLVENTAR LOS GASTOS D. ESTUDIOS D. SUS MENORES HIJOS.
LE GUSTARÍA MUCHO TENER MAS ADELANTE UN RESTAURANTE.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INTERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. MESAS Y SILLAS PARA UBICARSE FUERA D. SU CASA PARA OFRECER SUS PAPAS RELLENAS Y TALVES OTROS PRODUCTOS MAS.
texts.en:
Ms. Sara Edith is a 27-year-old mother of two underage children. She is a member of the La Esperanza del Valle Group, a communal bank of which she was recently elected president by her 9 group members.

Ms. Sara Edith has been selling stuffed potatoes as a street vendor for a living for six months. She prepares her dishes every morning, then goes out to various sports grounds, selling her stuffed potatoes throughout the adjacent streets.

She is making use of her charm because she is a very cheerful and friendly person. A friend gave her the idea of investing in a food business. With this business, she has been able to support her family--her two children--as she is both a mother and a father for them. Above all, she has been able to cover her children's educational expenses.

She would very much like to open up her own restaurant in the future.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing tables and chairs so that she can set them up outsiD. her home and sell her stuffed potatoes and possibly more dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture

loans.name: Senyi Tusitukirewamu Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Prossy, shown with her hand raised in the group photo, is an easygoing, 34-year-old woman running a ten-year-old retail business in Senyi, Lugazi district. She is a happily married mother with four rowdy schoolchildren.

In her shop, Prossy sells essential household items like sugar, beans, soap, and maize flour. The good rapport she has had with her customers from the start of her business has ensured she basks in some minimal success. Her good business graces have manifestly brought her to a point where she currently earns almost 70,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis.

After she had quite an engrossing experience working as a shopkeeper, Prossy ventured into her own business enterprise. With this loan, she hopes to significantly increase her retail business stock in a short period of time. She also hopes to educate all her kids fully to university level.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sugar, maize flour, soap, salt and so on

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of basic necessities

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife M. is from Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Marife is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Marife has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marife joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Marife is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be Marife's seventh loan from ASKI.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ninoska Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Ninoska  Cecilia  tiene la actividad como es venta de ropa usada. Ella es casada y su esposo trabaja para ayudar a pagar los gastos del hogar. Aduce la señora que el crédito ha influido positivamente en su vida, ya que ha ido invirtiendo y ha logrado aumentar el nivel de su negocio, brindándole mayores ganancias. Algo que ha influido en el buen manejo de su crédito, es la buena administración de su negocio y a la reinversión que siempre ha realizado en el mismo. Afirma la señora, que pese a que su negocio ha crecido, ahora ha mejorado el ingreso de su familia, lo que le permite brindar mejores atenciones a sus hijos. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ninoska Cecilia has a business selling used clothing. She is married and her husband works to help pay the household expenses. She says that having access to credit has positively influenced her life, since she has been investing and has managed to increase the level of her business, providing increased earnings. With good business management and the reinvestment that she has always done, she has been able to manage her credit well. She states that even though her business has grown, she is able to provide better attention to her children because of the increased income that it brings to the family. The loan she currently requests will be used to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry C. U., tiene la edad de 29 años, está soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de frijoles. La idea es  preparar  el terreno para la siembra de frijoles y darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de frijol, para cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias.  Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Henry  tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura, sobre todo en la siembra de granos básicos, el está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo proyecto. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Henry C. U. is 29, single, and does not have children. He lives with his parents. He wants the loan for his bean crops. The idea is to prepare the land for planting the beans and to give the crop adequate maintenance. This is so that they will be ready to harvest. Then he will be able to sell them and get better earnings. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Henry has several years of agricultural experience, especially with basic grains. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant basic grains (beans)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the village of  Talon Gingoog City. She is 40 and married with five adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop from selling both food and daily use products. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn G. is from the village of Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately $150 a month from this activity.

 In 2008, Cherrylyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase goods for production and sales. 

Cherrylyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

       About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

       *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase goods for production.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Nignia

texts.en:
Nignia A. is 49 years old.  She is married, and her husband is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.

Nignia is currently in the business of selling bread and fried fish at the market.  She is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil, tomatoes and onions to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S., from the village of Liwayway, Banisilan, Cotabato, is 44 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a service-based business providing wedding services and the renting of wedding dresses to local community members. Engaged in her enterprise for over five years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that used to purchase materials needed to provide service, she is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to invest in renovating the business. This will be Jocelyn's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco es un joven muy trabajador responsable que trabaja duro para mantener a su familia, el  se acerco a nuestras oficinas para poder solicitar un nuevo crédito, teniendo como destino la compra de mercadería en general (Azúcar, Harina, Aceite, Arroz, Conservas, etc.) esto para poder llenar y surtir su tienda de abarrotes, el cual recientemente  adquirió Debido a la nueva actividad económica y a venido trabajando de forma satisfactoria con la institución desde hace un tiempo atrás, su deseo del Sr. Marco es el de terminar sus estudios y poder asi mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco is a very hard-working, responsible young man who works hard to support his family. He came to our office to apply for a new loan, which will be used to buy general merchandise (sugar, flour, oil, rice, canned food, etc.) to fill and stock his grocery store, which he recently acquired thanks to the new economic activity. He has been working with our institution in a satisfactory way since some time ago. Sr. Marco's wish is to finish his studies and thus be able to improve the quality of life of his whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 46 years old. Josephine is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products to sell

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Viviana Esther

texts.es:
La señora Viviana Elena vive en  el municipio  de Malambo, con su cónyuge y dos hijos en las edades de15 y 17 años. Desde hace 20 años inició un negocio de comercio, actividad que aprendió de su mama desde muy niña cuando vivía en Soledad, otro municipio muy cercano a Barranquilla. Una vez se mudo a malambo , inicio este mismo negocio allí, vendiendo inicialmente calzado , ropa y artículos que le suministraba su mama, pero muy pronto aprendió a elaborar sus propias artesanías en foamy, madera, porcelanicron y arte country y decidió comercializarlas, como prueba piloto y le fue muy bien , pero aun no tenía suficiente capital para responder a sus pedidos,  fue así como se acerco  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y accedió a  su primer crédito por valor  de$ 1.200.000 COP con este financiamiento adquirió mercancía variada, como ropa, calzado y accesorios femeninos y también le alcanzo para comprar materias primas y fabricar sus hermosas artesanías;  asi fue como logro aumentar un poco su capital de trabajo e  independizarse de su madre. 
Gracias al negocio puede responder a los gastos del hogar como a la educación de sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo al sostenimiento de esta familia; su credikiva es el segundo y con el comprara laminas de foamy, lencería calzado, pintura y ropa, porque aprovechara la temporada de mayor repunte de sus ventas como el fin de ano donde las familias adornan sus viviendas,  anunciando que ya viene  las navidades, el ano nuevo y se visten elegantemente para esperarlo.
texts.en:
Viviana Elena lives in the municipality of Malambo and she lives together with her two children, aged 15 and 17. Since she was 20 years old she started her business. She learned the business from her mother since she was a young girl when she lived in the city of Soledad, another municipality near Barranquilla. When she moved of Malambo she started her business there. She started out by selling shoes, clothing and other merchandise and the business was overseen by her mother. Later she learned to make crafts out of crafters foam, wood, porcelain and using other media and she decided to start selling. The pilot project was successful but she didn't have enough capital to fill the orders she received so she sought out Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) for their support. She accessed her first loan in the amount of 1.200.000 COP and with it she purchased a variety of products, including clothing, shoes and ladies' accessories. She had enough money to purchase materials to make her beautiful crafts. This is how she managed to supplement her working capital and to make herself independent from her mother. Thanks to her business she has been able to cover the house hold expenses and her children's education costs; she was able to contribute with her husband to the family's support. This loan is the second she requests and with it she will purchase sheets of crafters' foam, sewing materials, shoes, paints, and clothing. She will endeavor to take advantage of the holiday season at the end of the year when the sales are the highest. Every family enjoys decorating their homes, in preparation for Christmas. Equally they prepare themselves for New Year's Day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheets of crafters' foam, sewing supplies, shoes, paints, and clothing.

loans.name: Solie Dominguez Group

texts.en:
Solie D., from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is the 31-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Solie, who is married and has two school-aged children, owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month.

In 2008, Solie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 12000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her fifth loan for 9000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Solie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
ViolaT. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Viola has had a hotel and bar business for three years. 

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase food and more drinks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Viola hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Viola hopes to expand her hotel business.    Viola is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by exercise classes during club activities.

loans.use: food and more drinks

loans.name: Gladys Janneth

texts.es:
Gladys Janneth M. M. tiene 21 años. Es casada vive el esposo y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.  Tiene 1 hijos.

Gladys pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Gladys  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Gladys Janneth M. M. is 21 years old, married, and lives with her husband and child in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She has one child.

Gladys is a member of the Guantucoto Communal Bank, which is located a half hour from Guaranda. This group engages in farming and ranching, especially corn and potato production in the mountainous areas as well as in the coastal region where rice is grown. The Communal Bank has 25 members.

Gladys has been farming for several years, growing potatoes and corn. She also raises and sells livestock animals. Gladys buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells at the wholesale market in the same city.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and potatoes. With the help of this loan, she will have the financial resources to acquire necessities for her family. The challenges she faces include pests and diseases that can impact her crops. Her dream is to purchase both a vehicle and a house.

Gladys enjoys going for walks.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing potatoes & corn

loans.name: Irma Elena

texts.es:
Irma tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda y reside junto a su familia en el sector Garcés del distrito de José Leonardo O., una zona urbana caracterizada por ser una de las más pobladas de la región, también es una de las más pobres, la mayor parte de su pobladores se encuentran concentrados en zonas urbano marginales.

Se dedica desde hace treinta años a la venta de verduras en el Mercado Moshoqueque, el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ella adquiere su mercadería de los comerciantes que vienen a dejar sus productos en el mercado, luego los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los comerciantes minoristas. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre se ha esforzado por mantenerlo.

Irma desea adquirir mas verduras para ampliar su negocio y responder de mejor modo a la demanda con la que cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante activa y responsable. Sus conocidos la consideran alguien de confianza y que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Irma is 57 years old and lives with her family in the Garcés sector of José Leonardo O. district, an urban area which is noted for being one of the most densely populated in the region.  It is also one of the poorest.  Most of its residents are concentrated in marginal urban areas.

Irma has been selling vegetables in Moshoqueque market, the city's wholesale market, for thirty years.  She acquires her merchandise from traders who come to leave their products in the market, then she sells them on to the general public and to retail salespeople.  Her business is an important source of income for her family which is why she has always worked hard to maintain it.

Irma would like to acquire more vegetables to expand her business and better respond to the demand which she has.  For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the sum of 1,000 nuevos soles which will help her to achieve her goal.

Irma is quite an active and responsible woman.  Her acquaintances consider her to be a trustworthy woman who is always in search of ways to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to expand her sales business in the market

loans.name: Koffi Nicola

texts.fr: Nicolas a 32 ans  et a en charge 3 ans. IL est marié à une coiffeuse de profession.  Il est né à Lomé et habite Nukafu où il a son atelier.  Pour s'occuper de ma famille, il exerce le mécanique et a associé la vente de pièces détachées. Il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite dans son atelier.Il cumule dans cette activité 5 ans déjà. IL sollicite un nouveau crédit pour augmenter son commerce
texts.en: Nicolas is 32 years and has a 3 year-old in his care. He is married to a hairdresser. He was born in Lomé and lives in Nukafu where he has his workshop. He works as a mechanic and also sells spare parts to support his family. He gets his supplies at the Lomé Grand Market and then sells them in his workshop.  He has operated this business for 5 years. He is requesting a new loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Ndeeba Tukorerehamwe Group

texts.en: T. Charity, with hand raised, is the leader of Ndeeba tukorerehamwe group in Kihihi. She is 28 years old and married with two children aged 7 and 5, and has been in the business of selling rice in Mizimera trading centre for two years. She started the business with capital from agriculture and because she is hard-working and cooperative, she has been able to specialize and she is benefitting from that. She is able to make KSH50,000 in weekly profits and she hopes it will continue increasing. She needs a loan to stock more sacks of rice for resale.

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica Domínguez Ramírez vive en la comunidad de Moyotepec, municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 52 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es Topógrafo y tiene 5 hijos Leonardo tiene 32 años de edad trabaja es ingeniero, Juan Carlos tiene 31 años de edad trabaja es Técnico en informática, Dulce María tiene 30 años trabaja es Licenciado en relaciones públicas, Israel tiene 26 años trabaja es licenciado en economía, Rodolfo  tiene 15 años está estudiando en el CBTIS de Cd. Ayala, La señora Verónica concluyó la educación básica y estudió una carrera comercial de secretaria ejecutiva. Su crédito lo va a utilizar principalmente para surtir su negocio, va a comprar medicamento de patente. Se entero de los préstamos de KIVA y Fundación Realidad por una amiga que la invitó. Ella tiene una farmacia en su localidad, en ella además de vender medicamentos, también vende productos de perfumería, ropa de bebe y regalos. Su negocio se llama Farmacia “Mega”, tiene este negocio desde hace 15 años. Anteriormente trabajaba en una farmacia en Cuautla, la gente que la conocía le recomendaba abrir una farmacia en su localidad, hasta que finalmente con la ayuda de su hermana establecieron la primera farmacia de la localidad, y entre las dos cuidaron el negocio y ya después le ayudo a su hermana a poner la suya. También tuvo un restaurante en su localidad pero lo quito porque no pudo contratar gente que supiera del negocio.
Ella renta un local que está a 200 metros de su casa, todos los días se traslada caminando hasta su negocio. Ella Considera importante su establecimiento porque tiene mucha comunicación con la gente, además de que le sirve de distracción y gana dinero. La parte que más le gusta de su negocio son las ventas, ella desde chiquita ya vendía en la casa de su mamá, era un terreno grande y había muchos árboles frutales, ella juntaba la fruta de los árboles en una canasta y salía a vender y el dinero se lo daba a su mamá para que comprara algo sabroso para comer. A los 14 años ya comparaba refrescos y los vendía a fuera de la casa de su mamá [después] me fui para Jalisco y comenzó a comprar manteles, sabanas, almohadones, servilletas que allá conseguía muy baratos y aquí les sacaba buena ganancias salía a Cuautla en el parque Zapata a vender su mercancía, Siempre le han gustado el negocio de las ventas
Su trabajo le da gran satisfacción porque puede comprar lo que ella quiere y le enorgullece decir que su trabajo saco adelante a sus hijos y los ayudo a tener una carrera universitaria. Sus clientes habituales son sus propios vecinos, en promedio atiende entre 20 y 30 personas de todas las edades al día. Sus clientes le compran porque saben que los trata bien y es por eso que su negocio es reconocido en la localidad. En la actualidad se han establecido otras dos farmacias en su localidad pero menciona que no le afecta mucho. Las ganancias de su negocio las invierte principalmente en mantener las existencias de medicamento de su negocio, además de pagar la renta del local y pagar un empleado, El préstamo de KIVA lo va a utilizar principalmente para comprar medicamento de patente y comprar una vitrina para exhibir peluches para regalos. Ella tiene sus planes y esperanzar de hacer unos locales para pasar su Farmacia y ya no pagar renta, las mejoras que desea lograr para el fututo de su hijo el pequeño son que siga estudiando y tenga una carrera, ella se siente feliz con el préstamo por qué va a surtir su negocio. Algunas de sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA son “les agradezco que puedan ayudarnos con este préstamo, para mejorar los negocio. El pueblo de Moyotepec le gusta porque aquí nació y aquí creció es de clima cálido, siembran caña, frijol, cebolla, milpa.
texts.en:
Verónica Domínguez Ramírez lives in the community of Moyotepec, in the town of Ciudad Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 52, married to a surveyor, and they have 5 sons and daughters: Leonardo, 32 who is an engineer, Juan Carlos, 31 who is in information technology, Dulce María, 30, who is in public relations, Israel, 26, who is an economist, and Rodolfo, 15, who is studying in the CBTIS of Ciudad Ayala.  Verónica finished basic education and studied to be an executive secretary.  She will use her loan to supply her business. She is going to buy patented pharmaceuticals.  She began with KIVA loans and Fundación Realidad through the invitation of a friend. She has a pharmacy in her neighborhood, and she also sells patented pharmaceuticals, perfumes, baby clothes and gifts.
