She purchases the commodities from farmers in small quantities, and because transportation to collect the produce is very expensive, Kadiatu makes very little profit. She would like to expand the business by purchasing her commodities in bulk to save on transportation time and expenses.   She is requesting a loan of approximately $700 US for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy commodities in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is a fishmonger and is married with five children. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing and then sells the fish to local costumers. She wants to increase her inventory to meet the demand of her costumers.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Qarsalan

texts.en: Qarsalan B. is 65 years old. He is married and has 5 sons and 5 daughters. He is very proud to have such a large family and works very hard to cover its needs. Qarsalan earns income breeding sheep in the Internally Displaced People's Settlement of the Bilasuvar region and has more than 30 years of experience in this business.  Summer is high season for wedding parties, at which mutton is a very popular dish. Therefore, Qaralan has decided to use this favorable time to expand his business. He has therefore applied for a loan of US$1,200 which he will use to purchase twenty sheep for breeding and, afterwards, sale for profit.

loans.use: Purchase of twenty sheep

loans.name: Maqsuda

texts.ru:
Maqsuda A. lives in the town Tirsun-zoda. She is 33 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her main occupation is farming. She grows vegetables and sells them on a market. She would like to obtain a credit so she would be able to purchase qulaity seeds and fertilizers. This will give her an opportunity to collect high quality crops. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Эшбуриева Максуда жительница города Турсун-заде. Возраст 33 года . Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается земледелием . Выращивает овощи и продает на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить качественные семена и удобрения. Это даст возможность получить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi:
Ms. D. Thi Thuy is 30 years old and joined TYM fund in 2005. Her family's main lines of production are agriculture and animal breeding. When she joined the fund, she borrowed money to invest in her animal breeding farm. Currently her family is raising pigs and ducks. She hopes to produce about 2 tons of pig meat yearly to market, and to have 200 ducks. After expenses, her daily income is 9.00 USD. Since joining the fund, their business has produced good results and the improvement in their income was quite evident. In 2007, her family saved up enough to buy a tractor to use on their farm, and to plow for others in the local area for a fee. For this loan, her family wishes to borrow 375.00 USD to invest in their animal breeding farm. Their average monthly income is 375.00 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Thủy 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2005. Gia đình chủ yếu sảm xuất nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tai gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ hàng năm bình quân gia đình chị xuất ra thị trường khoảng 2 tấn lợn thịt, số vịt đẻ gia đình chị nuôi là 200 con trung bình trừ chi phi mỗi ngày thu nhập 150.000đ. Từ khi tham gia vay vốn đầu tư dự án có hiệu quả nên kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt, năm 2007 gia đình chị đã tích lũy mua được 1 chiếc máy cày phục vụ nông nghiệp và làm dich vụ cày thuê cho bà con trong địa phương. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs farming

loans.name: Mwaka's Tusisahau Kwetu Group

texts.en:
Mwaka is 42 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 19 years old. She is a bucket producer. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

Mwaka is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaisha.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que son solteros e independientes.  Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas) desde hace 4 años, negocio con el cual se siente orgullosa de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos, trabaja todo el día, y le encanta mucho su trabajo porque socializa y aprende mucho.  Sus productos de belleza los deja al crédito o al contado y los lleva a ofrecer por los distintos lugares de su zona.  Ahora quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus bebidas heladas y por ello presenta esta solicitud de crédito.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother of three still-single children who are now on their own. She dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products and cold beverages (beer and soda), which she has done for the past four years. She is proud of her business and of managing to help her children get ahead. She works all day, and she enjoys it a great deal because she gets to socialize with others and learn a lot. She sells her products on credit or in cash, and she takes them around the various areas of her zone to sell. She would like to order a kiosk built where she could sell her cold beverages, which is why she is soliciting a loan.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for the selling of cold beverages.

loans.name: Edosa

texts.en:
Edosa I. sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She lives in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and has five children. Her husband is a retired civil servant.

Edosa sells provisions like toothpaste, bathing soap, and detergent. She needs a loan in the amount of N52,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell. She says that God will continuously bless Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Los Montones Group

texts.en:
Martha S. has lived a very difficult life. Her whole life she has been living in extreme poverty and has not found a way to generate a steady income. She is a 55-year-old single mother of two children. She came to Esperanza International in hopes of receiving a loan so she could start her own business, and she sees this opportunity as a way to change her fortune and to give her a purpose.

She has always wanted to be able to provide a good life for her children, and be able to travel and have her own house. Martha is going to start a small business selling clothing in her area, and is so excited to get started. She is going to buy cheap clothing and fix it herself to sell. She really feels like a change is coming for her and her family, and she is ready to do whatever it takes. She is a really hardworking woman. We are all excited about her future!

Martha represents a "Bank of Hope," of which she is one of 10 members.

loans.use: Buy material to make clothing

loans.name: Aureliana

texts.es:
La señora Aureliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 500 compró aceite lubricante para auto para venderlo en su local. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que tiene una tienda de filtros para auto. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará filtros y aceite lubricante para auto. 
Agustina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser propietaria de un grifo y un local propio donde vender sus aceites y filtros.
texts.en:
Aureliana is a member of the 'Dante Nava' Community Bank, in the province, district and department of Puno. She is 38 years old, single and the mother of three children. With her first loan of S/. 500 she bought motor oil to sell in her shop. She has worked with the community bank for almost one year and she tells us that she has a shop selling car oil filters. With this loan of S/. 1,500 to be repaid in 4 instalments she will buy filters and motor oil. Aureliana wishes to continue working to become the proprietor of her own petrol station and shop where she can sell motor oil and filters.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase car oil filters and motor oil

loans.name: Sadia Rana Yameen Group

texts.en:
"My name is Sadia and I married to a man whose name is R. Y., a salesman by profession. He deals with wholesalers and buys different items, specifically bakery items, and sells them to different shops. He has 15 years of experience in this business. I am the mother of 2 sons who are not of school-going age. I keep myself busy preparing embroidered dresses. I take orders from my neighbors and charge them $3 per dress. I have successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I’m applying again for a loan to buy bakery items (bread, butter) for my husband so that he will be able to sell them and earn a good income."

Sadia is the leader for another lady in her group. Khalida baji wants a loan to repair her working vehicle called “Shahzore”.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bakery items to re-sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el centro poblado Pueblo Libre, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios de secundaría incompleta (segundo grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas (manzanas, uvas, plátanos, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio según la época (sandia, uvas, etc.) 
Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 5 cuotas, podrá adquirir mas mercadería (frutas) para su negocio según la demanda y la época, tales como: Sandía, plátanos, Papayas, uvas, etc., con las ganancias ella piensa ayudar en la educación de sus hijos; asimismo su sueño es tener su auto propio (camioneta) para llevar sus productos a otras ferias de la región.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the community bank "03 de Mayo," in the El Collao province of Puno. She is 35 years old, and lives with her four children and their father. She has achieved a second-grade level education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos (a Kiva partner) for 6 years, and she sells fruit (apples, grapes, bananas, etc.). Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Soles, with which she was able to acquire merchandise for her business, depending on the season (watermelon, grapes, etc.). With this loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles, which she hopes to repay in 5 installments, she will be able to buy more merchandise (seasonal fruit) for her business such as: watermelon, bananas, papayas, grapes, etc.

With the earnings, she hopes to help with her children's education, and her dream is to have her own vehicle (a truck) to bring her products to other fairs in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise (fruit)

loans.name: Yuster

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Yuster M. from Mwanza. She is married and has three children between the ages of 15 and 24. She is also responsible for supporting two additional dependents because their parents do not take care of them.

Yuster has been running a clothes business since 2008. Her store sells kanga and vitenge, which are traditional kinds of clothing worn by Tanzanian women. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile: the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

Yuster works at her business eight hours a day, six days per week, and has one shop assistant. Yuster currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to add more traditional African clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Yuster thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thereby enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To add more traditional African clothes.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’agbalépédo, elle est divorcée de son mari et a 02 enfants, elle est très dynamique et travaille dure pour subvenir au besoin de ses enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce est la vente de chaussures, de pagnes, de sacs et de mèches. Elle désire agrandir son stock avec 02 cartons de chaussures,15 paires de pagnes, 01 carton de mèches et une dizaine de sacs. C’est pour cela qu’elle demande son premier crédit à WAGES.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Agbalépédo district. She is divorced and has two children. She is very energetic and works hard to provide for her children. The work she does involves selling shoes, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), bags, and hair extensions. She would like to expand her inventory with two boxes of shoes, fifteen pairs of pagnes, one box of hair extensions, and a dozen bags. This is why she's asking WAGES for her first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and cloth

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo sells drinks and snacks. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa P. lives with her husband and two teenage daughters in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two daughters are both high school students. Bayarmaa has a small business selling women's fashion accessories, such as creams and hair brushes. She occupies a small space outside the local market where she started her business in 2004. Small retailers who cannot afford to rent a stall inside the market place occupy small spaces outside the market door and try to sell their products. She purchases the items she sells from the wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia and brings them to Ovorhanghay. In the future, she would like to expand her business and be financially able to rent a stall inside the market. She requests a loan to purchase small items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Julia es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Julia es artesana, realiza tejidos en palito y bordados, Julia integra una asociación llamado Basilio Auqui integrado por 18 mujeres, los trabajos que realizan son a pedido y exportan a diferentes mercados.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana.
Julia sueña con ser empresaria, ampliar sus mercados y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Ollantay Village Bank. She is 50 years old and married with five children. Julia is an artisan who does knitting and embroidery. She is a member of a local association called Basilio Auqui, made up of 18 women who take orders and export their work to different markets. Julia needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy wool. She dreams of owning her own business, of exporting to more markets, and that her children will grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for knitting

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 55 year-old married man with 2 children living in Keter Maya, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a mini market since 2000. Today Omar is hoping to borrow $1,200 to be able to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ashogbon

texts.en: S. sells sand and gravel for house building. She gets her goods from the Lagos lagoon and the sandbar beach, from a boat service at the riverside. Then she uses a tipper or truck to supply her customers. She started this business eight years ago. She is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more sand. S. is 36 years old and is married with four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sand and gravel to sell
